language.lore: As Slardar has made the transition from the Deeps, it has been necessary to use his powerful tail for sprinting instead of swimming.
language.aghanimDescription: Provides additional HP Regen, Armor and Status Resistance while in a puddle or in the river.
notes: Activating this skill doesn't interrupt channeling abilities.

description: Slams the ground, leaving a puddle of water, and stunning and damaging nearby enemy units.  After the stun, the affected units are slowed.
language.lore: A swift crush of might and water breaks even the toughest of defenses.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases Slithereen Crush puddle radius and duration.
language.shardDescription: Increases Slithereen Crush radius, and causes it to apply Corrosive Haze for a short time to units affected.

description: After 3 attacks, your next attack will bash the target. Deals double damage against creeps. Passively grants bonus damage to Slardar while he's in water.
language.lore: Thieves of the wealth of the Deep Ones meet the brutality of the Slithereen Guard in melee combat.
notes: Does not stack with Skull Basher.

description: Reduces enemy armor to amplify physical damage and provides True Sight and vision of the targeted unit, revealing invisibility. The enemy unit leaves a trail of water behind it for 8 seconds.
language.lore: Even the strongest armor counts for little when left to the brine of the sea.

description: Summons a gush of water to damage an enemy unit, reducing their movement speed and armor.
language.lore: During his championship of the Sunken Isles, Leviathan gained mastery over the open sea.
language.aghanimDescription: Gush becomes a ground targeted wave ability that affects enemy units in a line.  Decreases cooldown.

description: Thickens Tidehunter's hide to passively block a portion of any incoming physical attack damage. The hide also removes negative status effects if the damage taken crosses a threshold.
Does not stack with items that provide Damage Block.
DISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
language.lore: Claddish navymen tell tales of a mighty sea-faring beast that suffered spear and sword but continued to lay waste to the fleet.
notes: Only damage from player owned sources is counted towards debuff removal.
The counter will reset if no player owned damage is taken for 7.0 seconds.
Kraken Shell removes most debuffs, even if they are generally not purgable.

description: Tidehunter swings his mighty anchor to attack and deal bonus damage to nearby enemies and reduce their attack damage.
language.lore: Stolen from one of Admiral Kunkka's flagships, Leviathan's heavy anchor proves useful as a melee weapon.
notes: Anchor Smash works on all Ancient creeps except for Roshan.
language.shardDescription: Anchor Smash now affects buildings and has increased damage and reduced cooldown.

description: Slams the ground, causing tentacles to erupt in all directions, damaging and stunning all nearby enemy units.
language.lore: Calling to the abyssal god Maelrawn has resulted in entire armadas being lost at sea.
notes: Ravage will hit invisible units.
Ravage waves move outwards at a speed of 725.

description: Fires a magic missile at an enemy unit, stunning and dealing damage.
language.lore: A simple Skywrath technique, the magic missile is Shendel's primary tool for vengeance.
language.shardDescription: Bounces once on an enemy, prioritizing heroes, within 75% of Magic Missile's current cast range from the first target.

description: Vengeful Spirit's presence increases the damage of nearby friendly heroes.
language.lore: Although they may not share her undying passion for revenge, allies do draw on her fanaticism in combat.
language.aghanimDescription: Upon death, creates a strong illusion of Vengeful Spirit that deals and takes full damage and can cast all of her spells. Illusion has 12 movement speed bonus. If the illusion is alive when Vengeful Spirit respawn, she will take its place. XP earned by her illusion is given to her. Strong Illusions are not instantly killed by spells.

description: Vengeful Spirit lets loose a wicked cry, weakening the total attack damage and armor of enemies, and giving vision of the path ahead.
language.lore: Shendel's haunting voice hints at her approaching vindication.

description: Instantaneously swaps positions with a target Hero, friend or enemy. Nether Swap interrupts channeling abilities on the target. Enemy Swapped units take damage. Vengeful Spirit and allied swapped units gain a barrier equal to the damage dealt.
language.lore: Martyrdom is a small price to pay for vengeance.
notes: Works on Spell Immune units.
Trees near Vengeful Spirit and the target will be destroyed when the spell is cast.
Channeling spells are interrupted by Nether Swap.

description: A burst of damaging frost slows enemy movement and attack rate in the targeted area.
language.lore: The air temperature around Rylai drops rapidly, chilling all around her to the core.
notes: Crystal Nova provides vision in the targeted area for the duration.

description: Encases an enemy unit in ice, prohibiting movement and attack, while dealing damage over time. Lasts 10 seconds on creeps level 6 or lower.
language.lore: Rylai channels winds from the Blueheart Glacier, imprisoning attackers in thick blocks of ice.
notes: Frostbite is considered a root.

description: Gives additional mana regeneration to all friendly units on the map. Allies within a 1200 radius of Crystal Maiden receive 3x the mana regeneration. Crystal Maiden herself receives 7x the bonus.
language.lore: Cold temperatures promote the essence of magic, causing Rylai's presence to allow spell usage in abundance.

description: CHANNELED - Surrounds Crystal Maiden with 100 random icy explosions that slow enemies and deal massive damage. Grants bonus armor while channeling. Lasts %abilitychanneltime% seconds.
language.lore: Once the place of her exile, Icewrack has become an anchor for Rylai's frigid onslaught.
language.aghanimDescription: Allows you to move, cast and attack during Freezing Field. Can still be interrupted by enemies. You move 0 slower during this. Increases total number of explosions by . Applies Frostbite to any unit that has been standing in the Freezing Field for over -1s.
notes: The slow is applied on all enemies in the radius, even if they aren't hit by an explosion (lasts 1.0 second).
Explosions occur every 0.1 seconds.
language.shardDescription:
Allows you to move, cast and attack during Freezing Field. Can still be interrupted by enemies. You move 0 slower during this.

Increases total number of explosions by .

description: Shackles the target to an enemy unit or tree in a line directly behind it. If no unit or tree is present, the stun duration is reduced to 0.6.
language.lore: Windranger's variety of bow skills includes an arrow with thick ropes attached to encumber any escaping target.
notes: This spell can shackle two enemies together, stunning them both.
Can shackle the target to an enemy unit or tree at most 575 behind the target.
Shackleshot can be disjointed.

description: CHANNELED - Windranger charges her bow for up to 1.0 second for a single powerful shot, which slows and deals more damage the longer it is charged. The arrow damages enemies along its path. For each enemy that Powershot hits, its damage and slow power is reduced.
language.lore: During her early years of training, Lyralei learned to fire powerful arrows that cleaved even trees to reach their targets.
notes: Powershot will destroy trees in its area of effect.

description: Increases movement speed and adds evasion from all physical attacks.
language.lore: Lyralei enchants gusts of winds to fight incoming attacks.
language.aghanimDescription: Windrun reduces physical damage taken by 0, and grants invisibility that is not broken by attacking or casting spells.
notes: Activating Windrun will evade incoming projectiles.

description: Windranger channels the wind to gain 350 / 425 / 500 additional attack speed against a single enemy unit or structure, though with a reduction to her attack damage. Extra damage from secondary item effects is not reduced.
language.lore: Lyralei's ability to bombard opponents with a flurry of arrows is unparalleled - even at the expense of accuracy.
notes: Issuing a Hold Position command will pause Windranger's attacks.
Windranger can move while attacking.

description: Blasts the target enemy unit with damaging frost, dealing area damage and slowing movement and attack rates for 4.0 seconds. The primary target receives both base and area damage.
language.lore: Frost-mage Ethreain has not forgotten even the simplest of ice manipulation.

description: Creates a shield around the target friendly unit or building, which adds armor and slows attacking units. Lasts 40.0 seconds.
language.lore: Originally crafted during his ambush for self-defense, the Lich is capable of enchanting others with a formidable defense of frost magic.
notes: If autocast is activated, Lich will cast this spell on nearby allies who are attacked.

description: Applies a magical frost shield around the target, reducing damage from attacks against it. While the shield is active, ice magic will affect nearby enemy units every 1 seconds, dealing minor damage and slowing them.
language.lore: First conceived of to protect him in his mortal years, the frost magic that Ethreain weaves around himself has only grown colder with time.
notes: Spell-immune enemies are not affected by the damage or slow.
Frost Shield can be cast on buildings.

description: Releases an orb of frost that bounces between nearby enemy units up to 10 / 10 / 10 times, slowing and damaging each time it hits. Each bounce increases the damage for the subsequent bounces.
language.lore: Almost universally considered the ultimate in frost magic, Ethreain's orb of frozen death strikes fear into those who dare stand against him.
notes: Chain Frost cannot be disjointed.
Chain Frost has a movement speed of 850.
Chain Frost doesn't bounce to Zombies.

description: Launches a cask of paralyzing powder that ricochets between enemy units, stunning and damaging those it hits. Each bounce deals more damage than the previous one. Deals 150% damage to creeps.
language.lore: The Witch Doctor recycles the bones of fallen friends and foes, using the powder as part of his arsenal of charms and alchemy.
notes: Targets can be hit multiple times, as long as another unit is struck in between the bounces.

description: Witch Doctor focuses his magic to heal nearby allied units, costing Witch Doctor mana every second Voodoo Restoration is active.
language.lore: Zharvakko's hocus pocus is not limited only to hexxing his opponents and is quite adept at curing ailments.
notes: Healing is done in 0.33 / 0.33 / 0.33 / 0.33 second intervals.
Can heal Spell Immune units.

description: Curses all enemy Heroes in a small area, causing them to take a set amount of damage each second, as well as bursts of damage every 4 seconds based on how much health they have lost since the curse began.
language.lore: Certain voodoo magics can make an enemy regret engaging the Witch Doctor.
notes: If an affected hero's health has increased above the amount they had when Maledict was cast, the burst damage will be 0.

description: CHANNELED - Summons a deadly ward to attack enemy heroes within its attack range. Lasts a maximum of 8.0 seconds. Death Ward has 50% bonus accuracy.
language.lore: Witch Doctor performs a ritualistic dance, one that haunts the dreams of those who live to recount it.
language.aghanimDescription: Death Ward attacks have True Strike and bounce between nearby enemies.
notes: The Death Ward is invulnerable, and is only destroyed if Witch Doctor is interrupted or its duration expires.
The Death Ward can be controlled, and made to attack a specific target.
Death Ward attacks once every 0.22 seconds.

description: Throws down a smoke bomb, silencing enemies, and causing them to miss attacks.
language.lore: Since his escape during the night of his betrayal, Riki has valued the use of a simple smoke screen to confuse his opponents.
notes: Can be cast during Tricks of the Trade.
Doesn't prevent the use of active items.
language.shardDescription: Enemies caught in the smoke screen have their armor reduced by 0 and cannot be targeted by their allies.

description: Teleports behind the target unit, momentarily slowing them and striking for bonus damage if it is an enemy.
language.lore: The Stealth Assassin's agile movement makes him impossible to escape.
notes: Riki's first attack after Blink Strike will be a backstab.
Blink Strike's damage is dealt before the next attack.
You can Blink Strike to allies, but no damage is dealt.

description: Riki fades into the shadows, becoming invisible. Every time Riki strikes his enemy from behind, he deals bonus damage based on his Agility. Bonus damage is doubled against non-hero units. When Riki attacks, he becomes visible. Grants bonus experience for hero kills and assists.
language.lore: Riki comes for you.
notes: Illusions of Riki will play Backstab animations, but not deal any bonus damage.
Riki cannot Backstab buildings or Tormentors.

description: CHANNELED - Riki phases out of the world while striking random enemy units from behind in an area around him. While phased out his attack damage is reduced, but his Agility greatly increases.
language.lore: The Stealth Assassin is not afraid to fight dirty, and specializes in attacking his opponents from behind.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases cast range, number of attacks and allows you to target an allied hero, hiding inside them for the duration.  Each attack hits an additional target.
notes: Moving while phased out will cancel the ability.

description: Focuses Enigma's power on a target, causing it to take damage and become repeatedly stunned for multiple instances. An instance strikes every 2.0 / 2.0 / 2.0 / 2.0 seconds.
language.lore: Strange gravities pull at the core of those who would oppose you, holding them in place.
language.shardDescription: Increases Malefice stun duration by 0.35s and creates an Eidolon next to the target every instance of Malefice stun. These Eidolons will not multiply further.

description: Summons three fragments of Enigma himself at the cost of health. The eidolons health is increased by 4% of Enigma's current health. These eidolons are all under Enigma's control, and repeated successful attacks cause them to multiply. When this happens, the eidolons have their health restored.
language.lore: Enigma is capable of drawing aspects of himself from other dimensions - the result is a trio of dark eidolons that hunt the corporeal plane.

description: Steeps an area in dark resonance, dealing 5 / 10 / 15 / 20 + a percentage of the enemies current HP as damage.
language.lore: A section of the world slowly descends into the void.
notes: This ability destroys trees in its area.
Multiple instances of Midnight Pulse do not stack.

description: CHANNELED - Summons a vortex that sucks in nearby enemy units.  Enemies affected by Black Hole cannot move, attack, or cast spells.
language.lore: The ground trembles as Enigma channels his ultimate vortex of destruction, a singularity with the power to end worlds.
language.aghanimDescription: Black Hole deals additional damage equivalent to 3.5 of the unit's Max Health per second and does a non-interrupting pull towards it in a 1200 AoE. Pulls at a rate of 175.

description: Fires an intense energy beam, dealing damage to the target and all enemy units around it. The main target is blinded, causing them to miss all physical attacks.
language.lore: Boush perfected this rock cutting laser in his subterranean laboratory, never considering its combat utility.
language.aghanimDescription: Upgrades Tinker's Laser into a Shrink Ray, granting +200 cast range and reducing the main target's size, current health, and maximum health by 10 (stacking) if it's a hero. The laser bounces once on the farthest target up to 700 range from the primary one, prioritizing heroes.

description: Launches rockets at the nearest visible heroes within 1500 range.
language.lore: The last contraption Boush was able to save was a retrofitted rocket launcher with a homing mechanism.

description: Enlists an army of robotic minions to destroy enemy units in an area around Tinker.
language.lore: Even though the laboratory has since been sealed off, the ability to radio in robotic drones is still in working order.
notes: Robots spawn at a rate of 24 per second.

description: CHANNELED - Resets the cooldown on most of Tinker's items and abilities and grants bonus magic resistance for 4 seconds.
language.lore: A new battery here, another set of rockets there, Boush continually improves on existing technology.
notes: Rearm works on all items except Aeon Disk, Arcane Boots, Black King Bar, Hand of Midas, Helm of the Dominator, Helm of the Overlord, Linken's Sphere, Meteor Hammer, Pipe of Insight, Refresher Orb, Revenant's Brooch (passive ability), and all neutral items.

description: Consumes a charge to launch a ball of shrapnel that showers the target area in explosive pellets. Enemies are subject to damage and slowed movement. Reveals the targeted area. Shrapnel charges restore every 35 seconds.
language.lore: Kardel's modular rifle also fires incendiary rounds, useful for assaulting entrenched locations.
notes: Damage is dealt 11 times, immediately at spell effect then every second.
Does not damage buildings.
Provides vision in the targeted area.

description: Sniper increases his accuracy, giving him a chance to deal extra damage and knock back his enemies. Headshots briefly slow enemy movement and attack speed by -100%.
language.lore: Taking potshots at steepstalkers in his childhood has been thoroughly refined into perfect leads on enemy combatants.
notes: Works on allied creeps.

description: Extends the attack range of Sniper's rifle. Can be activated to provide 100% Headshot chance and an additional 200 attack range bonus. Slows you by 45 / 40 / 35 / 30 for the duration.
language.lore: Kardel always takes it upon himself to stay as far from harm as he can while still performing his role - taking perfect aim.

description: Sniper locks onto a target enemy unit and, after a short aiming duration, fires a devastating shot that deals Sniper's attack damage plus bonus damage at long range and mini-stuns the target. Whenever Sniper kills an enemy hero, Assassinate is refreshed.
language.lore: In order to fulfill the prophecy and return to his home town, Kardel must make another shot as perfect as the one on the day of his ancient test.
language.aghanimDescription: Causes Assassinate to fire quicker and stun the enemy target.
notes: Crosshair effect is only visible to allies.
Invisibility doesn't disjoint the projectile.

description: Necrophos releases a wave of death around him, dealing damage to enemy units and healing allied units.
language.lore: Poor souls who succumb to Rotund'jere's plagues are recycled for future use.
notes: Death Pulse can't be disjointed.

description: Necrophos stills the hearts of his opponents, causing nearby enemy units to lose a percentage of their max health over time. Passively provides regen for 7 seconds for each unit Necrophos kills.
language.lore: Those who come within a short distance of Necrophos can feel pestilence and plague in the air.
language.aghanimDescription: Heartstopper Aura's Health Decay is increased by 0 of Necrophos's current health regeneration.
notes: Damage won't disable items like Blink Dagger.
Does not affect ancient creeps.

description: Necrophos slips into the realm that separates the living from the dead. Unable to attack or be attacked, he emits an aura that slows enemies around him. He takes additional magic damage in this form, but his restorative powers are amplified.
language.lore: Rotund'jere uses the souls of his victims as bridge from life to afterlife.
language.aghanimDescription: Reduces Ghost Shroud cooldown.

description: Stuns the target enemy hero, then deals damage based on how much life it is missing. If Necrophos kills an enemy this way, he'll permanently gain Health and Mana Regen. Any kill under this effect is credited to Necrophos.
language.lore: The amount of death and suffering in the air increases the power of Necrophos's plague magic.
notes: Damage is dealt at the end of the stun.

description: Binds several enemy units together, causing a percentage of the damage dealt to one of them to be felt by the others. Summons an imp from the corpse of any unit that dies while under the effects of Fatal Bonds that lasts for 15 seconds and explodes on death. Imps will automatically seek out nearby units, favoring fatally bonded heroes, and will explode when reaching their prey.
language.lore: An ancient incantation that links the vital energies of multiple lifeforms into one collective body.
notes: The shared damage type is the same as the type of damage inflicted.
language.shardDescription: Increases the power of all imps summoned by Warlock.

description: Warlock whispers an incantation, healing a friendly unit or damaging an enemy unit over time.
language.lore: Demnok's arcane arts have a myriad of uses, allowing them to be powerful friendly enchantments or damaging curses.
language.shardDescription: Turns Shadow Word into a %shard_aoe% AoE Spell.

description: CHANNELED - A powerful slowing and damaging current that grows stronger as it's channeled. Lasts up to 10 / 12 / 14 / 16 seconds. Enemies are slowed for 3.0 seconds after leaving the area or the spell ends.
language.lore: Demnok manipulates space-time, impairing entire armies.
notes: The slow increase is based on length of the channel, not the duration an enemy was standing in the area.
language.shardDescription: While channeling, Warlock spawns an imp every 2 seconds that lasts for 15 seconds and explode dealing damage to all enemies around them upon death.

description: Summons a Golem from the depths, stunning enemies for 0.8 seconds. The Golem lives 60 / 60 / 60 seconds, takes reduced damage from spells, has increased Slow Resistance, has Permanent Immolation and Flaming Fists on attack.
language.lore: Demnok unleashes the captive spirit in his Dreadwood staff, causing destruction in enemy ranks.
language.aghanimDescription: Calls 2 Golems with reduced stats and bounty.
notes: This ability destroys trees in its area of effect.

description: Deals extra damage to nearby units when attacking.
Burns the Golem's nearby enemy units, with damage per second.

Beastmaster sends his axes flying and calls them home again, slicing through enemy units and trees along their path.  Each axe can hit an enemy once, and amplifies subsequent damage from Beastmaster and his units.
language.lore: While learning to maneuver in nature alone, the Beastmaster also mastered the use of a pair of tomahawks, adept at cutting down trees as well as adversaries.
language.aghanimDescription: Causes Wild Axes to have no cooldown and can be used again once they come back.
notes: This ability destroys trees.

description: If motionless for some time, the hawk becomes invisible.
Inflicts a poison that slows attack and movement speeds.
Untaps the inner fury of nearby allies, passively increasing their attack speed.
language.lore: Beastmaster's ability to incite the innate strength of animals was seen in the mauling of the king of Slom.

description: Hurls a poisoned dagger which deals large initial damage, and then deals damage over time. The poisoned unit has its movement speed slowed for 15 seconds. An instance of damage is dealt every 3.0 seconds. Queen of Pain relishes in the pain inflicted, healing every time the enemy takes damage. Creeps heal for half the damage only.
language.lore: Akasha's envenomed dagger allows her to delight in the drawn out suffering of her victims.
language.aghanimDescription: Causes Shadow Strike to become a 0 AoE Spell, and have increased initial damage. When Shadow Strike ends or is re-applied to an enemy Hero, the target emits a Scream of Pain, hitting any nearby enemies.
notes: The affected unit slowly regains its original movement speed every second during the duration.
Units afflicted by Shadow Strike can be denied by their allies when their HP drops below 25% of their maximum health.

description: Short distance teleportation that allows Queen of Pain to move in and out of combat.
language.lore: The Secret Queen lives up to her title, making her pain impossible to escape.
notes: You can use Blink to dodge incoming projectiles.
language.shardDescription: Releases a sonic boom when Queen of Pain blinks, at both her starting and ending locations. Deals 125 damage in a 300 AoE and silences the target for 1.75 seconds.

description: The Queen of Pain lets loose a piercing scream around her, damaging nearby enemies.
language.lore: The sultry voice of Akasha beckons her opponents while stealing their souls.
notes: Scream Of Pain will hit invisible units.
Scream Of Pain cannot be disjointed.

description: Creates a gigantic wave of sound in front of Queen of Pain, dealing heavy damage to all enemy units in its wake and pushing them back.
language.lore: Her most exquisite of all of torments, Akasha's Sonic Wave puts her poor foes out of their misery.
notes: Sonic Wave can hit units up to 1150 units away.

description: Beastmaster lets loose a deafening roar that stuns, and shoves open a path to its target. All units in the path of the roar are damaged, while units shoved aside by the roar have their movement and attack speed slowed. Additionally, Beastmaster and his units gain 40% movement speed for 3 seconds.
language.lore: The Beastmaster has learned to channel his primal instincts into an animalistic roar, causing devastation in the ranks of enemies.
language.shardDescription: Causes anyone that attacks a Primal Roar target to deal 1.3x Critical Strike.

description: Launches a ball of venom in a line, poisoning enemy units so that they take both initial damage and damage over time, as well as suffering slowed movement.  Venomous Gale deals damage every 3 seconds over its duration.
language.lore: A concoction of various stings, poisons, and toxins gathered from the jungles of Jidi Isle, victims surviving it are rare.
notes: Venomous Gale can be lethal. Units afflicted by Venomous Gale can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.
Duration damage is dealt every 3.0 / 3.0 / 3.0 / 3.0 seconds.
Slow starts at -50 / -50 / -50 / -50%, and decreases as time passes.
language.shardDescription: Increases travel range, and when Venomous Gale impacts enemy Heroes, it creates Plague Wards around them.

description: Adds poison damage to Venomancer's normal attacks and slowing movement speed.
language.lore: The paralytic sting of the creature which caused his transformation now belongs to the Venomancer.
notes: Poison Sting damage can be lethal.
Damage from Poison Sting does not interrupt healing from items, nor does it activate the cooldown on Blink Dagger.

description: Summons a plague ward to attack enemy units and structures. The ward is immune to magic. Wards gain the Poison Sting level from Venomancer, dealing 50% of the full damage.
language.lore: A mixture of his old herbalist talents and newfound toxic mastery creates a living embodiment of plague.

description: Whenever Venomancer dies or the effects of Venomous Gale end prematurely on an enemy hero, a spreading ring of poison erupts. Enemies hit by the poison will take non-lethal magic damage over time and have their magic resistance reduced. This effect can trigger every 10 seconds and cannot be refreshed.
language.lore: In the Acid Jungles, creatures releasing noxious poison to their attackers is common; Venomancer spreads this plague beyond the Jidi Isle.

description: Rushes to a target location while backtracking any damage taken the last 2.0 seconds.
language.lore: Darkterror tears a hole in time, passing through Claszureme, and appearing back in an instant.
language.aghanimDescription: Applies a Time Lock to all units at the landing destination.
notes: Faceless Void is invulnerable while using Time Walk.
language.shardDescription: Increases range

description: Adds the chance for an attack to lock an enemy unit in time while attacking it a second time.
language.lore: The strike of the Faceless Void lands with dimension shifting force.
notes: Does not stack with Skull Basher.

description: Creates a blister in spacetime, trapping all units caught in its sphere of influence and causes you to move very quickly inside it.  All ability and item cooldowns are frozen. Only Faceless Void and any units he controls are unaffected.  Invisible enemies in the sphere will be revealed.
language.lore: When a rift opens to Claszureme, all poor souls caught within will likely never return.
notes: Pauses all units and buildings, friendly or enemy, except those owned by Faceless Void.
Faceless Void is never affected by Chronospheres with any owner.

description: An exploding pulse deals damage to enemies and structures in the area. Deals 65% damage to structures.
language.lore: The Arts of Oblivion include a deafening blast of emerald flames from the Nether Reaches.
notes: Damage is delayed by 0.8 seconds.

description: A powerful banishing spell that slows a unit and renders it unable to attack or be attacked. Healing on affected allies is increased, while afflicted enemies take extra magic damage instead. Can be cast while channeling.
language.lore: A now-mastered relic from his childhood, Pugna delights in banishing others into the Nether Realm, whether for good, evil, or simple enjoyment.
notes: Only magical and pure damage can affect a unit under the effects of Decrepify.
Doesn't slow allied units.
Can be used on your Nether Ward.

description: Pugna places a Nether Ward at the target location. The ward will fire at any enemy hero who casts a spell dealing base damage plus the damage multiplier of the mana spent by the enemy hero.
language.lore: While at the lamasery for the Arts of Oblivion, Pugna learned to dominate his classmates with a simple ward charged with Nether magic.
notes: Nether Ward deals damage before the actual spell is cast, so if the caster dies the spell will have no effect.
Nether Ward can be decrepified.
Illusions and creeps deal 25% damage to Nether Ward.
language.shardDescription: Increases cast range.

description: CHANNELED - When cast on an enemy, Pugna drains health from the target enemy unit to heal himself and granting vision over the target. If Pugna has full HP, and the enemy target is a Hero, Life Drain will restore mana instead.
When cast on an ally, Pugna will drain his own health into his ally.
language.lore: Pugna has truly become more powerful than even the grandmaster of Oblivion.
language.aghanimDescription: Reduces cooldown by %abilitycooldown%s. When targeting an enemy hero, Pugna reduces their outgoing spell damage by 0 per second up to a maximum of 0 and increases his own, up to a maximum of 0. When draining through a Nether Ward using Shard, the rate of increase/decrease is 0 instead. Debuff lasts 0 seconds.
notes: Illusions are destroyed on the first tick of damage.
language.shardDescription: Life Drain can target your Nether Ward, causing life drain to refract to all enemy heroes within %abilitycastrange% units of the ward for 75 of its normal value. The effect is interrupted if the ward is destroyed.

description: Throws a dagger slowing the enemy unit's movement speed, dealing 65 / 70 / 75 / 80+ 25 / 40 / 55 / 70% of Phantom Assassin's attack damage as physical damage and applying attack effects from items and abilities.
language.lore: The first skill learned by the Sisters of the Veil often signals an incoming hit.
notes: If an attack effect is chance-based, the chance of its application will be the same as its chance to occur.
Spell-immune enemies are not affected by Stifling Dagger's slow.
Stifling Dagger grants vision around its location while it travels and upon impact.

description: Teleports to a unit, friendly or enemy, and grants bonus attack speed while attacking if it's an enemy unit.
language.lore: Mortred's silken veil is the last thing her unfortunate target sees.

description: Phantom Assassin focuses inward, increasing her ability to evade enemy attacks. Can be activated to blur her body, causing her to be impossible to see until near enemy heroes, towers, or outposts.
Stacks diminishingly with other sources of Evasion.
language.lore: Meditation allows a Veiled Sister to carefully anticipate her opponents in combat.
language.aghanimDescription: Causes Blur to have instant cast time and applies a dispel. Any time Phantom Assassin gets a hero kill, her abilities are refreshed. Reduces cooldown.
notes: Attacking Roshan with a regular attack will dispel Blur.
language.shardDescription: Increases your movement speed by 40% while in Blur's active.

description: Phantom Assassin refines her combat abilities, acquiring a chance of gaining Deadly Focus with each attack. When attacking with Deadly Focus, Phantom Assassin will consume the buff and guarantee a critical hit. Stifling Dagger has a bonus chance to cause Deadly Focus.
language.lore: A divine strike, Mortred honors her opponent by choosing them for death.

description: Templar Assassin becomes highly elusive, avoiding damage and gaining a bonus to her damage.  The damage and avoidance effects are separate, and have a limited number of instances.
language.lore: Manipulating her psionic veil, Lanaya bends nature's law to her will.
notes: Damage as HP Removal bypasses Refraction (it won't reduce the charges).
Only instances of 5 or more damage will trigger Refraction.
Refraction is visible to enemies.

description: Templar Assassin conceals herself, becoming invisible as long as she remains still. If Meld's invisibility is broken by attacking an enemy, Lanaya will deal bonus damage to the enemy and reduce their armor for 12 seconds.
language.lore: Lanaya is as elusive as her covenant with the Hidden Temple.
notes: Meld is broken by any action other than staying in position or channeling Psionic Projection.
Meld's armor reduction does not work against towers.

description: Templar Assassin's psi blades slice through the attacked unit, splitting and damaging enemy units directly behind it, while gaining bonus attack range. For each unit it damages, the spill damage is reduced by a percentage.
language.lore: Her blades pierce the skin as much as the mind, furthering her understanding of the mystery that is reality.
notes: Split damage hits invisible units.
Attack effects like Bash will only be applied to the main target.

description: Templar Assassin places mystical traps that invisibly monitor enemy movement. When sprung at her command, they deal a small amount of damage and exert a slowing influence of 30% in the area. Traps charge up to slow 60% after 3.5 seconds. Deals bonus damage when fully charged.
language.lore: Calling upon the reach of the Hidden Temple, none escape the eye of the Templar.
notes: Traps last indefinitely.
They have invisibility that fades in over 2.0 / 2.0 / 2.0 seconds, spell immunity, and 100 HP.
Traps have 400/400 vision range and don't prevent neutral camps from spawning.
language.shardDescription: Increases max trap count and trap vision range.  When activated, traps now silence affected enemies.

description:
Springs the trap nearest to Templar Assassin, slowing nearby enemies.

If the ability is in alt-cast state, springs the trap that is closest to the mouse cursor.
Springs the trap, slowing nearby enemies.
Deals damage to the unit that kills the Necronomicon Warrior.
Reveals invisible units.
Mana burned per hit, a portion of which is dealt as damage.
Launches an arrow that burns away the targeted unit's mana, dealing damage equal to the amount of mana burned.
Increases movement of nearby units.
Returns the courier to base
Transfer items to hero
Return items to stash
Retrieve items from stash
Summons a protective shield around the courier
The courier gains a burst of speed for 6.0 seconds
Roshan will block one targeted spell every 15 seconds. Also reduces status effects by 25%.
Roshan has a chance to stun on attack.
Roshan slams the ground, damaging and slowing all nearby enemies. Slam's damage will increase every minute.

Roshan possesses numerous protective abilities, including 55%% magic damage resistance, the ability to reduce damage from attacking illusions, and a scaling armor bonus that increases as time goes on.
Intensifies Viper's venom, adding an effect to his normal attack that applies a stacking movement speed slow and magic resistance deduction while dealing damage over time. Stacks up to 5 times.
language.lore: The Netherdrake's inborn toxic breath quickly drains the vitality of its afflicted.
language.shardDescription: Increases max stacks, and causes Poison Attack to lower armor per stack and to affect buildings for reduced damage.

description: Viper releases a Nethertoxin at the targeted area. Units in that area take an increasing damage over time based on how long they remain in it. Units in it have their attack speed slowed.
language.lore: Poison from the Nether Reaches turns wounds into fatalities, and fatigue into death.

description: Viper exudes an infectious toxin that damages and slows the attack speed of any enemy that damages it in a 1400 radius. The acid exudate also increases Viper's resistance to magic.
language.lore: It is not unusual for sword and shield alike to corrode in the very hands of those who attack the Netherdrake.
language.aghanimDescription: Corrosive Skin applies 2x the damage and attack speed slow to enemies that are within 500 distance of Viper.
notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other magic damage resistance sources.

description: Viper slows the targeted enemy unit's movement and attack speed while also disabling their passives and dealing poison damage over time.  The slowing effect reduces over the duration of the poison.
language.lore: Once used to slay his sadistic summoner, the most powerful of Netherdrake infections spreads through the veins of those foolish enough to cross Viper.
language.aghanimDescription: Decreases mana cost and cooldown. Increases cast range.

description: Calls a beam of lunar energy down upon an enemy, damaging and briefly stunning them.
language.lore: Selemene smites those who encroach upon the Nightsilver Woods.

description: Empowers Luna's glaives, causing her attacks to bounce between enemy units. Deals less damage with each bounce.
language.lore: Carefully sharpened, Luna's boomerang-like weapon cuts a wide swath through enemy numbers.
notes: Moon Glaives do not proc any attack modifier except Critical Strikes.
language.shardDescription: Moon Glaives can be activated to create 0 glaives that rotate in a 0 radius around Luna for 0 seconds, reducing damage she takes by 0. Any unit that collides with a glaive will take 0 of Luna's Attack Damage.

description: Increases the attack damage for Luna and nearby allied heroes, with Luna receiving 200% of the attack damage bonus allies receive. At night Lunar Blessing is global, and Luna is blessed with increased vision range.
language.lore: The Goddess of the Moon smiles upon her kin.
language.shardDescription: Lunar Blessing can be cast to smoke allied heroes within 800 range. Break Range and Bonus Movement Speed are stronger at night time. Additionally increases Eclipse Night time by 10s

description: Showers random nearby enemies with strikes from Luna's current level of Lucent Beam. These beams do not stun their targets, and there is a maximum number of times that a single target can be struck. Also turns day into night for a short time.
language.lore: In times of great need, Selemene herself descends into the world, blocking out the light and hope of the opposed.
language.aghanimDescription: Allows Luna to cast Eclipse on an allied unit or herself and have its effects follow them, or cast it on an area. Also increases total beams, reduces duration, removes the limit on beams per unit, and makes the beams appear twice as fast.
notes: Eclipse doesn't work if Luna doesn't have any points in Lucent Beam.
Beams will stop if Luna is killed.
Will not hit invisible units.
There is a 0.6 / 0.6 / 0.6 seconds gap between beams, 0.3 seconds with scepter.

description:
Unleashes a breath of fire in front of Dragon Knight that burns enemies and reduces the damage their attacks deal.

Applies the debuff from Corrosive Breath and Frost Breath Dragon Form is of the corresponding level.
language.lore: Knight Davion's breath has become that of the mighty Eldwurm Slyrak, remembered for burning numerous other knights to a crisp.

description: Dragon Knight smites an enemy unit in melee range with his shield, stunning it while dealing damage based on their enemy max HP. When in Elder Dragon Form, the cast range increases to 450.
language.lore: Davion's combination of dragon talents and knightly skills makes him a vicious opponent in melee combat.

description: The life blood of the Dragon improves health regeneration and strengthens armor.
language.lore: Slyrak's blood still courses through Davion's veins, giving him twice the vitality of an ordinary knight.

description: Dragon Knight takes the form of one of three powerful elder dragons, increasing his speed and Dragon Tail's range, while granting him new powers.
<font color=\"#9acd32\">LEVEL 1 Green Dragon</font> - Corrosive Breath: attacks deal 25 / 25 / 25 / 35 poison damage per second for 5.0 / 5.0 / 5.0 / 5.0 seconds. Works on structures.
<font color=\"#ff0000\">LEVEL 2 Red Dragon</font> - Splash Attack: attacks damage all enemy units in a 350 radius for 75 / 75 / 75 / 100% damage, with Corrosive Breath added to the targets.

<font color=\"#87ceeb\">LEVEL 3 Blue Dragon</font> - Frost Breath: slows movement speed by 0 / 0 / -40 / -60% and attack speed by 0 / 0 / -40 / -60 of enemy units in Splash Attack range for 0 / 0 / 3.0 / 3.0 seconds, with Corrosive Breath added to the targets.
language.lore: The dormant dragon power springs forth from within Davion, combining the powers of a legendary knight with a legendary Eldwurm.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases the level of Dragon Knight's ultimate. Adds a 4th level, Black Dragon. Black Dragon has bonus Corrosive Damage, Splash Damage and Slow amount, 25% increased Magic Resistance and free pathing.
notes: Corrosive Breath poison damage is lethal.
Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Dragon Knight was in when the item was used.
language.shardDescription: Grants Elder Dragon Form the Fireball ability.

description: Releases a cone of poison that strikes multiple enemy units. Deals damage over time and slows the targets. Anytime the targets get attacked by Dazzle, the debuff duration is refreshed and slow is increased.
language.lore: One of the few Dezun rites used for offensive purposes, the paralytic enchantment often proves useful.
notes: The damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.
Units afflicted by Poison Touch can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.
language.shardDescription: Causes Poison Touch to hex affected targets for 0 seconds.

description: An ally blessed with Shallow Grave, no matter how close to death, cannot die while under its protection. Healing on that ally is also amplified for the duration based on the hero's HP.
language.lore: Only a seasoned acolyte of the Shadow can properly perform the rite of preventing death.
notes: HP cannot go below 1 while under the effects of Shallow Grave, but Axe's Culling Blade will still kill the hero.

description: Sends out a bolt of power that arcs between allies, healing them while damaging any enemy units standing nearby.  Dazzle is always healed by Shadow Wave.
language.lore: While it is a simplistic and routine rite among Shadow Priests, the Shadow Wave is also the most critical for success.
language.aghanimDescription: Shadow Wave can now target and bounce between enemies in addition to allies. When bouncing to an enemy, they will take damage and heal nearby allies equal to 150 of the normal healing and damage values. Dazzle will also perform an attack against any enemy that Shadow Wave bounces to.
notes: Prioritizes allied heroes over creeps.
If enemies are near multiple allied units affected by Shadow Wave, they will take multiple instances of damage.

description: Applies a buff that increases the armor of allied heroes while decreasing the armor of enemy heroes in the target area over time.
language.lore: His ethereal journey into the Nothl realm has allowed Dazzle to mend together the powers of light and dark, creating shifting waves of enchantments.
notes: Places a buff on units, so entering or leaving the area after the cast has no effect.

description: Discharges high-powered shrapnel at random nearby enemy units, dealing minor magical damage and ministun. Deals double damage to creeps.
language.lore: Some of Rattletrap's contraptions don't quite work correctly, so detonating them proves useful as an offensive maneuver.
notes: Remains active if Clockwerk is disabled.

description: Forms a barrier of energized cogs around Clockwerk, trapping any units that are near. Allies in the cogs when they are created receive a magic damage barrier. Enemies outside the trap that touch a cog are knocked back, losing health and mana. Once a cog has delivered a shock, it will power down.  Cogs can be destroyed by enemy attacks, but Clockwerk can destroy them with just one.
language.lore: One of Clockwerk's inventions of which he is most proud is the power cog - though it is sometimes despised by his allies.
notes: Cogs can shock invisible units.

description: Fires a global range flare that explodes over a given area. Upon impact, enemies in the area take damage and are briefly slowed. Rocket flare provides vision over the impact area for 6.0 seconds.
language.lore: What started as a festive display has become a useful scouting and bombardment tool.

description: Fires a grappling device rapidly at the target location. If the hook hits a unit, Clockwerk launches himself into the target, stunning and dealing damage to everyone in a 175 / 175 / 175 radius around the hit target. Any enemies Clockwerk collides with along the way are damaged and stunned.
language.lore: A somewhat unwieldy device, the Hookshot sends the otherwise clunky Clockwerk armor flying through the air.
notes: Hookshot will latch and take Clockwerk to allies, but not damage or disable them.

description: Splits the earth under enemies. Deals damage and stuns for a short duration.
language.lore: Twisting nature to his vile will, the shifting earth consumes those unlucky enough to cross Leshrac's path.
notes: Split Earth will destroy trees in its area of effect.
There is a 0.35 second delay before the effect is applied.
language.shardDescription: Causes Split Earth to repeat in the same location 3 additional times, with a 5 second delay between each one. Each time the radius increases by 55. Split Earth echo location is visible to both teams.

description: Saturates the area around Leshrac with magical explosions that deal pure damage to enemy units and structures. The fewer units available to attack, the more damage those units will take. Lasts 10 seconds.
language.lore: Chronoptic energy bursts from one plane to the other, evaporating anything it touches.
notes: The explosions will continue even if Leshrac is killed.
Can damage buildings, Spell Immune units, and invisible units.

description: Summons a lightning storm that blasts the target enemy unit, then strikes any nearby enemy units. Struck enemies have their move speed and attack speed slowed.
language.lore: The Tormented Soul's mastery of the elements is evident in the massive storms that strike down armies before him.

description: Creates waves of damaging energy around Leshrac, one per second, to damage nearby enemy units. Drains Leshrac's mana with each pulse.
language.lore: If necessary, the Tormented Soul can manipulate space time itself, ravaging lesser beings.

description: Sprouts a ring of trees around a unit, damaging and trapping it in place and providing vision in a 250 radius.
language.lore: Verdant overgrowth is a common ailment reported by Nature's Prophet's attackers.
notes: Sprout can be cast on any unit, or the ground.
Trees created by Sprout have the same interactions with abilities as regular trees.
A Tango that consumes a tree created by Sprout provides the standard healing effects.

description: Teleports to any point on the map. After teleporting, Nature's Prophet gains stacks of bonus attack damage. Every attack consumes a stack of bonus damage to increase Nature Prophet's armor.
language.lore: The Prophet keeps his sentinel over the forest, protecting it when in need.
notes: Mana and cooldown take effect when the cast is completed.  Nature's Prophet will not use any mana or waste the cooldown if the spell is interrupted while casting.
When the cast begins, an effect is created at the target location, which is visible to allies and enemies.

description: Converts an area of trees into Treants under the command of Nature's Prophet.
language.lore: Verodicia bestowed the Prophet with the ability to summon the Treant Guard, a mythical sentient army of the wild.
notes: Nature's Call can only create as many treants as there are trees in the target area.

description: Damaging energy bounces around the map, striking enemies close to the cast point that are in vision. Each enemy hit beyond the first adds damage.
language.lore: Nature's Prophet calls Verodicia's fury to strike down those who might ravage the wilderness.
language.aghanimDescription: Lowers cooldown by %bonus_AbilityCooldown%s. Entangles all enemies it hits. Duration scales from 2s up to 3.8s seconds at max bounce.
notes: Wrath of Nature will not hit units out of vision.
Can be cast through the minimap; the nearest valid target will be selected.

description: Launch into a maddened rage, becoming Debuff Immune, increasing magic resistance by 80%%, and gaining increased movement speed.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: The madness and brutality of N'aix makes him a vicious and unrelenting foe in combat.
notes: Upon casting, many buffs and debuffs will be removed.

description: Lifestealer's attacks deal damage and provide heal for a percentage of his target's max health.
language.lore: After escaping from his cell in Devarque, N'aix subsisted on flesh and bones of those unfortunate to cross his path.
notes: Does not affect Roshan.
The heal is independent of the damage.
Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

description: Lifestealer rends an enemy unit, slowing the victim's movement speed and allowing all allies to regain health for a percentage of the damage they deal to that unit. All damage dealt will steal life, including damage from spells. The victim recovers movement speed over the duration. Deals 2% of the target's max health per attack on the target from real heroes. After receiving 500 damage, the Open Wounds fester and spread to a non-infected random enemy within 700 radius.
language.lore: Fresh wounds and the scent of blood often draw out the scavengers to finish the job.
notes: Open Wounds slows over 8 different steps: 50% / 50% / 40% / 30% / 20% / 10% / 10% / 10%, with the slow decreasing one step per second.
Stacks additively with other sources of Lifesteal.

description: Lifestealer infests the body of a target unit, becoming undetectable, and healing for a portion of his max hitpoints every second while inside. He can then explode from the host body, dealing damage to nearby enemies. If the infested unit is an enemy creep or a neutral creep, he can take control of the unit's ability to move and attack. Does not work on enemy heroes.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: With this infestation, N'aix consumes the life blood of the host, restoring him back to full unholy power.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases cast range and reduces cooldown to %bonus_AbilityCooldown%s.  Infest may target enemy heroes for a short duration, disarming them and attacking them from the inside while increasing Lifestealer's regeneration rate.
notes: Lifestealer gains experience while under the effects of Infest.
Creeps that are controlled while Infested gain Infest's movement speed bonus.
Infest Level 2 and 3 can be used on Ancient creeps.

description: Lifestealer eats the host body from the inside out, exploding from within.
Dark Seer creates a vacuum over the target area that sucks in enemy units, disrupting them and dealing damage.
language.lore: Ish'Kafel modifies the center of gravity to a place of his choosing.
notes: This ability interrupts channeling.
Pulls units over 0.3 / 0.4 / 0.5 / 0.6 seconds before dealing damage.
Trees near the center of the vacuum will be destroyed.

description: Surrounds the target unit with a bristling shield that damages enemy units in an area around it.
language.lore: The Dark Seer slices holes into the 'Land Behind the Wall,' causing prismatic energy to seep forth.
notes: Deals small amounts of damage in 0.2 second intervals.
Doesn't damage the target it is cast on.
If cast on a unit that already has Ion Shell, the new Shell replaces the old one.
language.shardDescription: When Ion Shell is cast on an enemy, it slows them for %enemy_target_slow%, the radius is increased by %enemy_target_bonus_radius% and Ion Shell's cooldown is reduced by %enemy_target_cooldown_reduction%s. The enemy is also pulled at a rate of %pull_strength% units toward any other unit affected by Ion Shell.

description: Charges a target friendly unit with power, giving it a brief burst of phased movement speed. Allows the unit to reach maximum movement speed and cannot be slowed.
language.lore: Ish'Kafel once used his speed of mind to navigate the maze between the walls.
notes: Units with Surge cannot be slowed unless the Surge effect is removed.
language.shardDescription: Surged units leave behind a 0 radius trail that lasts 7s, slows enemies around it by -50 and deals 35 damage per second in 0.5s intervals. Can be put on alt-cast to disable the trail.

description: Raises a wall of warping light that slows, damages, and creates replicas of any enemy hero who crosses it. Enemy replicas serve at the Dark Seer's will. Replicas last until they are destroyed, or until the wall's duration ends.
language.lore: The Dark Seer, while unable to return to his natural realm, can channel part of the prismatic wall with powerful strength of mind, sowing confusion amongst enemy ranks.
notes: Doesn't create illusions from other illusions.
There cannot be more than one illusion per player per wall.
Wall of Replica will not slow spell-immune enemies.

description: CHANNELED - Clinkz channels and shoots multiple piercing arrows in the target direction that hit all enemy units dealing a percentage of Clinkz' attack damage and applying attack modifiers, and dousing enemies with Tar Bomb slow.
language.lore: It's hard to say whether the blur around the Bone Fletcher is from his flaming heart or his speed with the quiver.
notes: Bonus Attack Range increases the length of Burning Barrage.

description: Imbues Clinkz's arrows with fire for extra damage.
language.lore: Clinkz simply lights his arrows from his flaming essence for quite the destructive effect.
notes: Searing Arrows deal damage to structures.
The damage is directly added to Clinkz' attack damage, as physical damage.

description: Clinkz moves invisibly through units until the moment he attacks or uses items. Leaving Skeleton Walk creates Burning Skeleton Archers
language.lore: With a burst of fire and puff of smoke, the Bone Fletcher was nowhere to be seen.
notes: Has a fadetime of 0.6 / 0.6 / 0.6 seconds.

description:
Clinkz consumes the target enemy creep or friendly skeleton and creates a Burning Skeleton Archer in their place, healing and gaining max health. Does not take Clinkz out of Skeleton Walk.

Archers are immobile and die within several attacks from a hero. Skeletons deal a percentage of Clinkz' damage. Attack range is equal to Clinkz's attack range. Only one archer can be summoned from Death Pact at a time.

Skeletons deal 25% less damage to buildings
language.lore: Sutherex' bond of life and death has become a part of Clinkz, and his old bones are refreshed with repetition of the pact on lesser beings.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases Skeleton Archer Hits to Kill.
notes: If the target is an enemy, Clinkz will gain the correct experience and gold.
Increases Clinkz' current and max HP.
When the duration ends, max HP returns to normal, but current HP stays the same.

description: Instantly heals a friendly unit and damages all nearby enemy units.
language.lore: Priests of the Omniscience are adept at removing impurities from fellow warriors.

description: Creates a divine barrier around an ally which grants them increased Status Resistance, Strength and Health Regeneration.
DISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
language.lore: When faced with the pit of sacrifice, Purist's resilience to magic was tested and affirmed.

description: Greatly degenerates the movement capabilities of enemy units that stray too near.
language.lore: The holy embodiment of Purist Thunderwrath is enough to weaken those of lesser faith.
notes: Does not affect Debuff Immune units.

description: Omniknight calls upon a Guardian Angel that grants a target ally immunity from physical damage.
language.lore: The All Seeing One casts down his protection over those that Purist calls friend.
language.aghanimDescription: Grants one extra charge and global cast range. Always casts a Guardian Angel on self as well as the selected target

description: Enchantress beguiles her enemies, slowing their attacks when she is attacked.
language.lore: After attacking Aiushtha, most opponents are overwhelmed with guilt having attacked such a natural beauty.
notes: All units who directly attack Enchantress will get slowed.
The slow is applied on the attacking unit when the attack starts, not when damage is applied.

description: Enchantress charms an enemy. If the enemy is a hero, they are slowed and damaged for 5s.
If the enemy is a creep, she brings it under her control, increasing its attack damage and max health. Enchantress can control up to 1 creeps at a time for up to 30 / 60 / 90 / 120s.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: A true steward of the forest, Aiushtha befriends all within it - from lowly trolls to powerful centaurs.
language.aghanimDescription: Enchantress can control multiple creeps at a time.
notes: Illusions can be converted.

description: A cloud of wisps heals Enchantress and any friendly units nearby. Lasts 9 / 10 / 11 / 12 seconds.
language.lore: Whimsical spirits of the woods possess a healing power that is quite subtle, but gains strength in numbers.
notes: Units with full HP will not be selected for the heal.
language.shardDescription: Adds %shard_permanent_wisp_count% permanent Nature's Attendants that follow Enchantress around.

description: Places an enchantment on each attack while activated, causing it to deal additional damage based on how far away the target is.  The farther the target, the greater the damage dealt. Deals double damage to creeps and illusions.
language.lore: While Aiushtha favors peaceful means, she is capable of a magical onslaught from a distance, her spears gaining energy from the natural life around her.
notes: The damage is capped at 1750 distance.
Distance to target is measured when the projectile hits.

description: Unlocks the regenerative power of a friendly unit, with healing based upon its primary attribute. If the target is below 35%, it will heal faster. Lasts 16 / 16 / 16 / 16 seconds.
language.lore: While Huskar has little use for magic, this minor enchantment was learned from the Dazzle and the Dezun priests, to be used in times of great injury.
notes: The HP percentage is checked every second and the regeneration adjusted accordingly.
Can be cast on Spell Immune units.

description: Huskar sets his spears aflame, dealing damage over time with his regular attack.  Multiple attacks will stack additional damage.  Each attack drains some of Huskar's health.
language.lore: The Sacred Warrior ignites his weaponry after marking it with his own blood - causing far greater pain than he himself feels.
notes: Burning Spear stacks additively when used multiple times on one target.  There is no cap.
Huskar cannot kill himself with this skill.

description: Huskar's injuries feed his power, giving increased attack speed, magic resistance and health regen based on missing health. Health regen is a percentage of your strength.
language.lore: After losing his birthright, Huskar gained a lethality in physical combat that is only heightened as his own blood is spilled.
notes: Bonuses are provided linearly, no bonus at Full HP and full bonus at strictly less than 10% HP.

description: Huskar draws upon his health to break an enemy's life, leaping at a target to shatter a percentage of that hero's current health and slow both their movement and attack speed.  While leaping, Huskar is Debuff Immune and has 50%% increases magic resistance.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: No matter the danger, Huskar thrusts himself into melees that only he can survive.
language.aghanimDescription: Forces the enemy target to attack Huskar and increases cast range.
notes: If Huskar is disabled during the charge or the target moves more than 1400 units in 0.015 seconds, the charge stops.
Slow works on Spell Immune units.
Life Break cannot be disjointed.

description: Creates a damaging void that slows an enemy unit and deals damage. At night, Void also mini-stuns, interrupting channeling abilities, and the slowing effect lasts longer.
language.lore: Balanar creates a vortex of infinite night, tearing opponents violently into the eternal darkness that once was.
language.aghanimDescription: Void becomes an area of effect ability. Increases the mini-stun duration and leaves behind a void zone. While in the zone, all of Night Stalker's abilities are empowered with their night time effect.
notes: Void does not ministun enemies during the day.

description: Night Stalker horrifies all nearby enemies, causing them to become silenced and take damage over time while near him.  The effect lasts longer at night.
language.lore: A vision of the twisted maw of Balanar etches itself into the minds of the poor souls unlucky enough to cross his path.

description: Night Stalker is in his element at night, attacking and moving with great swiftness.
language.lore: The hunting prowess of Balanar improves as the night beckons.
language.shardDescription: Hunter in the Night may be cast on a creep, instantly killing it and restoring some of Night Stalker's maximum health and mana. Cannot target ancients during the daytime.

description: Night Stalker smothers the sun and summons instant darkness, so that he might use his powers at their fullest. Refreshes the cooldown of all non-ultimate abilities when cast. Night Stalker gains flight and bonus damage during this time. Has unobstructed vision.
language.lore: It is a humbling sight to see when the mightiest of warriors become afraid of the dark.

description: Broodmother injects her young into an enemy unit, dealing damage. The spiderlings will hatch if the target is killed while under this influence.
language.lore: Black Arachnia continues to raise her young, even amidst the field of combat.  The brood quickly learns how to support their mother.
notes: If the target is killed within 20 seconds of being hit with this skill, the Spiderlings will spawn.
Units killed by Spiderlings will then give birth to Spiderites, smaller and less powerful versions of the Spiderlings.

description: Spins a large web that grants Broodmother a passive movement speed increase, increases her Turn Rate, and boosts regeneration while in its vicinity, as well as giving free movement. Spin Web charges restore every %abilitychargerestoretime% seconds, with a max of %AbilityCharges% charges. Spin Web can be cast from anywhere as long as the new web touches an existing web. Webs never expire, and can be manually destroyed. When the maximum limit of webs is exceeded, the oldest web disappears. The movement bonus is proportional to the unit's HP
language.lore: Weaving a bed of silken fibers, Arachnia's web both protects her and her offspring, as well as giving advancing opponents a sense of foreboding.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases movement speed, and increases Spin Web max count
notes: Also affects Spiderling and Spiderites.
Grants full movement speed bonus at 100% HP, 0% movement speed bonus at 1HP

description: Broodmother's venom cripples enemy units, causing her attacks to slow and giving the affected unit a chance to miss its attacks.
language.lore: Paralytic toxins come from Black Arachnia's fangs, causing a slow and painful death to those who intrude on her webs.
notes: The miss chance stacks with evasion and terrain dodge chance.

description: A violent lust for vital fluids increases Broodmother's attack damage and gives her a vampiric attack. Lifesteal from creeps is reduced by 40%.
language.lore: While most of her prey is wrapped in silken cocoons and saved for her young, the Broodmother herself has a taste for wandering heroes.
notes: Fully stacks with other sources of lifesteal.
language.shardDescription: Increases duration. While Hunger is active, the bonus damage is increased by 0 every 1s.

description: Applies debuff on attack. If debuffed unit dies, a spiderite will spawn.
Slows enemies with each attack.

Hurls a deadly shuriken at an enemy unit, dealing damage and briefly slowing the target. The shuriken will bounce to any Tracked units who are within a 1200 radius of each other. Deals bonus damage to Tracked targets.
language.lore: While the shuriken may be small, Gondar's precise aim can cause critical damage.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases cast range and applies Jinada on hit.

description: Bounty Hunter plans his next hit, dealing bonus damage and stealing some unreliable gold.
language.lore: Gondar's vast experience ensures he never walks away from a transaction empty-handed.

description: Bounty Hunter becomes invisible and gains the ability to move through other units until he attacks or uses an ability.  If he breaks the invisibility with an attack, that attack will stun the target for a short duration.
language.lore: The court jesters present during King Goff's assassination can recount no other image than a dancing shadow.
notes: Will not break most channeling of spells upon activation.

description: Tracks an enemy hero, granting True Sight of the target, and information on how much gold it is carrying. Bounty Hunter moves fast when near the tracked unit and deals critical strikes when attacking it. If the target dies, Bounty Hunter and nearby heroes collect a bonus bounty of gold. Casting Track does not take you out of invisibility.
language.lore: Using his elevated senses of sight and smell, Gondar's hits have quite a good chance of success.
notes: Bounty Hunter will get the bonus gold if the target dies while Track is active, regardless of how it died.
Track's effect is only visible to allies.
You can see the amount of gold the target is carrying by mousing over the debuff icon above the target's ability bar.
Bonus gold is reliable gold.
language.shardDescription: Allows Track to be ground targeted, creating a Bear Trap. After 3 seconds, the trap becomes invisible and active. Walking over the trap applies Track. Traps have 400 vision. Max Traps: 8. Ground targeting with Track has bonus 1200 range.

description: Weaver launches a swarm of 12 / 12 / 12 / 12 young Weavers that latch on any enemy unit in their path, attacking and reducing armor until it is killed.
language.lore: Skitskurr opens a gap in the space time fabric, allowing young Weavers to slip through and aid him in combat.
notes: When a beetle latches on a target, it will remain there until it is killed or the duration expires.
Beetles are Spell Immune, but can be killed in 6 / 6 / 8 / 8 attacks from a unit. Heroes deal double damage to beetles.
Beetles provide vision.
language.shardDescription: Reduces cooldown by 2 seconds, and causes The Swarm to latch onto and reveal invisible units.

description: Weaver shifts out of visibility, gaining max movement speed --doing harm to any enemies it passes through.
language.lore: As the Weavers worked in the fabric of creation, small wormholes allowed them to slip through time to better work their craft.
notes: Can only damage the same unit once per cast.
language.shardDescription: Shukuchi puts a mark on enemies it damages that last 0 seconds. 0s after Weaver exits Shukuchi, enemies with a mark within 0 range will also be attacked with a secondary Geminate attack

description: Allows Weaver to dispatch two attacks at once.
language.lore: Skitskurr's relationship with time is somewhat variable, causing his actions to be witnessed - and felt - more than once.
notes: Additional attacks leave Weaver 0.25 seconds after the previous one, and have no range limit.
language.shardDescription: Geminate Attack will also hit units within 1200 range of the original target that have The Swarm beetles attached to them.

description: Weaver warps backward to whatever position it was in five seconds earlier--regaining the HP and mana from that time. No effect on cooldown, gold or experience.
DISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
language.lore: If Skitskurr does not deem the current reality of the world to fit his desires, he simply crawls back in time to right what was wronged.
language.aghanimDescription: Time Lapse may target allied Heroes with %abilitycastrange% cast range.
notes: Removes most negative buffs from Weaver.
Time Lapse disjoints projectiles.

description: The Kobold Foreman's cruel efficiency increases his movement speed and the movement speed of all nearby allies.
The fearsome Hellbear attacks more quickly and bullies nearby allies into following suit.
The Centaur Conqueror's powerful hooves stomp the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemies. Heroes recover more quickly.

The Vhoul Assassin has soaked his weapons in his own blend of painful predator venoms that causes his enemies' natural regeneration to work against themselves. Heroes recover from the poison more quickly.
An icy blast followed by a wave of fire launches out in a path in front of Jakiro. The ice slows enemies, while the fire delivers damage over time.
language.lore: Pyrexae dragons have tremendously dangerous breath for each branch of the species; combining them is unimaginable.
notes: Can hit units up to 1025 range away.
Has a 0.2 second interval between each breath.

description: Creates a path of ice that stuns and damages enemies that touch it.
language.lore: Jakiro's cunning right head calls upon its frozen heritage, glazing the earth with blistering cold.
notes: It takes 0.5 seconds for the path to reach its full extent.
The stun is removed once Ice Path is destroyed.

description: Jakiro burns his enemies in an area of effect with fire added to his attack, while slowing their attacks.
language.lore: The left maw of Jakiro opens, laying waste to any in its path.
notes: Works on both units and buildings.

description: Jakiro exhales a wide line of lasting flames, which deals damage per second to any enemy units caught in the fire.
language.lore: Ice and fire combine to rip the battlefield to shreds with extreme temperatures.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases Macropyre duration, width and causes it to deal Pure damage. Jakiro emits two walls of ice along the edges of the Macropyre that slow any enemies trying to cross them by 0.
notes: Units hit by Macropyre will continue to be affected after they leave the area for 2 additional seconds.

description: The Ghost launches an eerie attack that chills her enemies to their bones.
The Hellbear Smasher claps his massive hands together, creating a deafening blast. The blast damages nearby enemies and throws them off their footing.
This creature does not feel the effects of most magical spells.
The Ogre Frostmage summons an invisible layer of icy air that surrounds the target friendly unit, increasing its armor and temporarily slowing any enemies that dare attack it.
The Dark Troll Summoner tosses netting around an enemy's feet, briefly immobilizing the unit, though the unit can still attack and use abilities.
The Dark Troll Summoner stirs the ground underfoot, raising the remains of trolls long dead, bringing to life three skeleton Warriors who will fight at his side.
The Giant Wolf's ferocious attacks occasionally tear a vital tendon, inflicting critical damage.
The cruel Alpha Wolf attacks his enemy's unprotected vitals at every opportunity, inflicting critical damage.
The Alpha Wolf's ruthless attacks do extra damage. His commanding presence inspires nearby allies to attack ruthlessly as well.
The Tornado's overpowering winds slow all nearby enemies, flinging debris at them and inflicting damage every second. Enemies closer to the center of the Tornado take more damage.
CHANNELED - The Wildwing calls on the spirit of the wind, creating a sentient Tornado that he can control. The Tornado slows nearby enemies and does damage. It is invulnerable and can move anywhere.
The Wildwing Ripper's fury numbs it to attacks and inspires nearby allies to withstand more blows.
The Satyr Banisher knows every trick in the book, allowing him to dispel debuffs from allies or buffs from enemies. His trickery also slows the enemy's movement.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Can be cast on invulnerable units.

description: The Satyr Mindstealer removes a fragment of his enemy's soul, burning away mana equal to 20 / 25 / 30 / 35 + 2 / 2.5 / 3 / 4x the target's intelligence, and dealing damage equal to the amount of mana burned.
The Satyr Tormenter tears open an unstable rift to the underworld, creating a shockwave that travels in a line along the ground, dealing damage to enemies it hits.
The Satyr Tormenter's demonic communion allows him to emanate regenerative power, increasing the health regeneration of himself and all nearby allies.
The Hill Troll Priest lays his holy blessing upon the target ally, replenishing some health.
The Harpy Stormcrafter releases a high-voltage bolt of electricity at the target enemy, dealing damage. The bolt jumps to other nearby enemies, losing power with each jump.

Drenches an area in sticky oil, amplifying damage from Batrider's attacks and abilities and slowing the movement speed and turn rate of enemies in the area. Additional casts of Sticky Napalm continue to increase damage, up to 10 / 10 / 10 / 10 stacks. Applies a small amount of damage with each cast.
language.lore: It's not uncommon to hear the Rider cackle while he increases the flammability of his opponents.
notes: All damage from Batrider gets amplified, except for Radiance, Orb of Venom, Urn of Shadows, and Spirit Vessel.
Sticky Napalm does not require turning to cast.
Sticky Napalm deals 50% damage to creeps.
language.shardDescription: Flaming Lasso no longer disarms you. Every other attack applies a stack of Sticky Napalm.

description: Hurls an explosive cocktail that explodes when it reaches the target location, knocking back, slowing and dealing damage over time to enemies in the area.
language.lore: A molotov cocktail is the weapon of choice for Batrider.
language.shardDescription: Causes Flamebreak to have two charges and apply a Sticky Napalm charge on impact.

description: Batrider takes to the skies, laying down a trail of flames from the air.  The fire damages any enemies it touches, and destroys trees below Batrider.
language.lore: When an enemy escapes into the Yama Raskav Jungle, most would cut through the brush to find the fugitive.  Batrider just chooses to destroy the jungle along with his foes.
notes: During this the Batrider can fly above units, trees and impassable terrain.
If duration ends when above impassable terrain, the Batrider can get stuck.
The trail persists through Batrider's death.

description: Lassoes an enemy and drags them in Batrider's wake. Dragged units cannot move, attack, or use abilities.  Teleporting or blinking will break the lasso.
language.lore: Few dare to ask to ride on the bat, as Batrider gives them free of charge.
language.aghanimDescription: Flaming Lasso grabs both its target, as well as the target's nearest allied hero within 0 units. The secondary target is tethered to the first.
notes: Killing the target or the Batrider will break the lasso before its expiration.
If Batrider moves more than 425 units in 0.05 seconds the lasso breaks.
Batrider cannot attack while using Flaming Lasso.

description: The Black Dragon's explosive attacks are felt by all nearby enemies.
The Drakken Sentinel has assumed a partially ethereal form, making him difficult to hit with attacks.
The Drakken Armorer moves about quickly, making him difficult to hit with attacks.
The Drakken Armorer is wholly devoted to his cause, increasing his tolerance for physical attacks. Nearby allies are similarly devoted to the Overseer and are able to withstand more blows.
Forces an enemy unit to move slower and for allies to attack it more quickly. Chen can attack the Penitence target with bonus attack range.
language.lore: Although Chen's brand of animal enthrallment isn't quite strong enough to control the minds of enemy heroes, it still tests their resolve in combat.

description: Deals random damage to test an enemy unit's faith. Heals a random amount to allied units. Always applies the maximum effect when cast on yourself.
language.lore: Knights of the Fold possess a fanatical form of magic that is considered quite unwieldy by most other users of arcane arts.
notes: Can target spell immune allies.

description: Chen takes control of an enemy or neutral creep and receives gold equal to its bounty. If the persuaded creep's base health is naturally below the health minimum, its base health will be raised to the health minimum. Converted creeps will have increased movement speed and bonus damage.
language.lore: Although they may not be knights, Chen incorporates beasts into the Fold in the same way he himself was converted.
language.aghanimDescription: Grants persuaded creeps Martyrdom ability. Sacrifice the life of this unit to heal an ally or damage an enemy with the current level of Hand of God.
notes: Persuading a new creep above max unit count causes the oldest persuaded creep to die.
Can target Ancient creeps when Chen has Aghanim's Shard.
The health of creeps already under Chen's control does not update to the new level upon leveling Holy Persuasion further.
Fully restores the creep's mana upon converting.
language.shardDescription: Allows Holy Persuasion to target Ancient creeps. Can control up to 1/2/3 Ancient creeps based on Hand of God's level. Additionally levels up some abilities of creeps by 1 level.

description: Heals all allied heroes on the map as well as all units under Chen's control. A large heal is applied at first and a slow heal over time is applied for 8 seconds afterwards.
language.lore: Using the mental link with his thralls, Chen calls down restoration and well-being to those who share his fanaticism.
notes: Can heal invulnerable and hidden/banished allies.

description: The Ancient Thunderhide slams his mammoth body against the ground. The shock damages nearby enemies and throws them off their footing. Heroes regain their balance more quickly.
