The Ancient Thunderhide works an ally into a frenzy, causing his ally to have increased attack speed.

Spectre flings a dagger to draw a Shadow Path, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed of any enemies along the trail. Units hit by the dagger also trail a Shadow Path. While treading the path, Spectre phases through otherwise impassable terrain. Spectral Dagger applies an instance of Desolate to targets with no allied units within 400 radius of them.
language.lore: Mercurial's dagger eclipses the physical plane in shadow, a state in which mortals cower, but spectres thrive.
notes: There is a 1.0 second grace period after leaving the path where no collision is preserved.

description: Deals bonus damage whenever Spectre attacks an enemy that does not have any allied units within a 400 radius around them.
language.lore: Often times, warriors find themselves alone with a vision of Mercurial - the fated question is if it is the true Spectre.
notes: Damage is dealt before Spectre's attack.
Spectre's illusions also have Desolate.

description: Damage done to Spectre is reflected on her enemies, leaving her unharmed. The effect lessens with distance.
language.lore: A daunting task lies before enemies of Mercurial - killing a shadow with blade and magic.
notes: The reflected damage is not dealt to Spectre.
Illusions don't get this ability.
Damage is reflected before reductions, and is returned as the same damage type.
language.shardDescription: Dispersion can be activated to increase damage dealt by reflection by 0% for 0s. Cooldown 0. Manacost 0.

description: Creates a spectral nemesis to attack each enemy hero. Illusions spawned from this ability follow the same rules as Shadow Step illusions and can also be swapped to by using Reality.
language.lore: At the height of combat, Mercurial's physical manifestation shatters, and the shadowy pieces haunt those who still cling to life.

description: Spectre exchanges places with a chosen Haunt and casts the current level of Spectral Dagger on the haunt's target.
language.lore: The scattered shadows unite into the one true Spectre.

description: Consumes an enemy or neutral creep, acquiring any special abilities that it possessed and gaining armor temporarily while it digests the creep. If alt-cast is deactivated, Doom will not acquire the creep's abilities. Duration is equal to the cooldown.
language.lore: Lucifer's appetite and greed are never sated.
notes: Gives Doom the original bounty of the creep, along with the bonus gold.
If you devour a creep without abilities, you'll keep the abilities you had previously.
language.shardDescription: Allows Devour to be cast on enemy heroes, reducing their maximum health by 15%  for the duration of the devour and provides Doom with a passive basic ability they have.

description: Carpets the nearby earth in flames which damage enemies, while also granting him increased movement speed.
language.lore: The Fallen One spreads destruction in his wake, sparing none from the flame which sustains him.
notes: Scorched Earth follows Doom, centered on his location.
language.shardDescription: Heals Doom and his controlled units for 0 of the damage dealt.

description: Doom swings his burning sword, igniting the enemy. Stuns for 0.6 seconds and applies a 4.0 second burn that deals a base damage plus a percentage of the target's Max HP as damage per second.
language.lore: Lucifer shares the fire branding bestowed upon him at the time of his exile.
notes: Interrupts channeling abilities.
language.shardDescription: Infernal Blade stun duration is increased. If the enemy's level is a multiple of 3, or above level 24, they will be stunned for a longer duration and take bonus damage.

description: Inflicts a curse that dispels an enemy Hero and prevents them from casting spells or healing in any way, while taking damage over time.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: When a name is tolled from the bell of Vashundol, doom is sure to follow.
language.aghanimDescription: Allies in a 0 radius around the doomed target also suffer the effects of Doom. Allows Doom to be self-cast to affect enemies around himself.
notes: Units afflicted by Doom can be denied when their HP drops below 25%.

description: This slot will be replaced with abilities acquired using Devour.
This slot will be replaced with abilities acquired using Devour.

Places a frozen hex on an enemy unit that deals damage over time, but can be dispelled by moving away from the initial cast point.  If the enemy unit doesn't move outside of the given range, it will be stunned and frozen in place after 4 seconds.
language.lore: Kaldr's presence draws those around him into a frozen void, threatening to lock them in an icy prison for eternity.
notes: Deals damage every half second.

description: Creates a vortex of icy energy that deals damage, slows and increases magic damage done to enemies in its range.
language.lore: Frozen, caustic winds are at the whim of Kaldr, chilling the field of battle.
notes: Provides vision in a small area where it is placed.

description: Enhances Ancient Apparition's attack with increased range, heavy magic damage, and movement slow.
language.lore: The Ancient Apparition's eternal knowledge brings a frigid enchantment to his attacks.
language.aghanimDescription: Removes cooldown and reduces manacost by %bonus_AbilityManaCost%.

description: Launches a tracer toward any location on the battlefield, which must be triggered again to mark the area to be blasted by a damaging explosion of hail. The further the tracer travels, the larger the explosion will be. Enemies caught in the explosion, or who touch the icy ball of hail as it travels, are Frostbitten, taking damage and prevented from regenerating or healing. If a Frostbitten unit's health drops below a certain percentage, they will instantly shatter.
language.lore: Ice storms from ages past flow through Kaldr's frosty limbs, crashing into the world and turning its inhabitants into monuments to his eternal power.
notes: Upon cast, this ability is replaced by Release, used to stop the tracer on the target area.
The area of effect is 275 + 50.0*TimeTraveled, capped at 1000. The freeze area along the path is 275.
Kill will be granted to the source of the damage that triggers the shatter.
The shatter effect doesn't work on illusions.
The HP Freeze prevents most kinds of healing, including the fountain, except Sunder, Time Lapse and Supernova.
language.shardDescription: Freezes enemies hit with the current level of Cold Feet for 0% of the duration.

description: Releases the ice blast to explode at the tracer's current location.
Structure takes reduced damage, and quickly regenerates any damage taken while no enemy creeps are nearby.
Structure takes reduced damage, and quickly regenerates any damage taken while no enemy creeps are nearby.
Inflicts a poison that slows attack and movement speeds.

Spirit Breaker fixes his sight on an enemy unit and starts charging through all objects.  All enemy units passed through and the targeted unit will be hit by a Greater Bash.  If the targeted unit dies, Spirit Breaker will change his target to the nearest enemy unit to that location.
language.lore: Barathrum erupts from the darkness with unwieldy force.
language.aghanimDescription: Reduces Charge of Darkness cooldown and makes it pierce debuff immunity.
notes: Spirit Breaker passes through trees, cliffs, and units.
The charge indicator is visible only to allies.
Spirit Breaker gains shared vision of the target.

description: Causes Spirit Breaker to gain power with higher movement speed. His presence increases the movement speed of nearby allied units. Can be cast to improve the movement speed bonus for 6 seconds.
language.lore: Aspiring heroes gain speed and power from simply observing the Spirit Breaker's dominance on the battle field.

description: Gives a chance to stun and knockback an enemy unit on an attack. Deals a percentage of movement speed as damage. Deals 1.3x damage to creeps.
language.lore: The signature strike of Barathrum's ghostly ball and chain.
notes: Does not stack with Skull Basher.

description: Spirit Breaker slips into the nether realm, reappearing next to his hapless victim. Upon reappearing, a Greater Bash of the current level occurs and deals bonus damage. Knocks back for double the normal distance.
language.lore: Barathrum temporarily returns to the realm from where he came, bringing with him the retribution of both worlds.
notes: Spirit Breaker appears behind the target to deliver the bash.
language.shardDescription: Causes Nether Strike to grant spell immunity, and deal extra damage and apply Break.

description: Ursa leaps forward 250 units and slams the earth, causing a powerful shock to damage and slow all enemy units in a nearby area for 4.0 seconds.
language.lore: The very steps of a male ursine shake the ground as well as the resolve of opposing warriors.
language.shardDescription: Earthshock applies a 1.5 second Enrage on Ursa when cast.

description: Using his skill in combat, Ursa gains increased attack speed and slow resistance for a number of subsequent attacks.
language.lore: For a behemoth of his size, Ursa is deceptively nimble.
notes: Overpower isn't removed by Black King Bar.
Missing an attack still consumes a charge of Overpower.

description: Ursa's claws dig deeper wounds in the enemy, causing consecutive attacks to the same enemy to deal more damage. If the same target is not attacked after 8 / 12 / 16 / 20 seconds, the bonus damage is lost.
language.lore: In nature, the wounded rarely survive the attacks of hungry predators.

description: Ursa goes into a frenzy, providing damage reduction and status resistance. Removes any existing debuffs.
DISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
language.lore: Ulfsaar succumbs to his ancient spirit, becoming the most ferocious creature on the battlefield.
language.aghanimDescription: Reduces cooldown and allows Ursa to use Enrage while disabled.

description: Launches a salvo of rockets at nearby enemy units in a radius around the Gyrocopter. Gyrocopter has increased resistance to slows during this time. Lasts 3 seconds.
language.lore: Aurel's new craft has an increased payload for rockets, enhancing their rapid-fire capabilities.
notes: Rocket Barrage can't hit units Gyrocopter has no vision over.

description: Fires a homing missile to seek the targeted enemy unit. The missile gains speed over time, dealing damage and stunning when it impacts the target. Enemy units can destroy the missile before it reaches its target.
language.lore: The biggest missile Aurel could possibly attach to his craft, The Bomb™ has carefully calculated aerodynamics and explosives for maximum impact.
notes: Towers do half damage to the missile.
The crosshair effect is visible to allies only.
The missile will follow and hit invisible units.
language.shardDescription: Homing Missiles now constantly fires the current level of Rocket Barrage in a 700 area of effect after 1.0 second of being cast. This Rocket Barrage prioritizes the Homing Missile target.

description: Gyrocopter's attacks hit all enemy units in an area around it for a limited number of attacks. Only the main target of attacks will receive attack bonuses such as Critical Strike. Lasts 12 seconds or until the attacks are used.
language.lore: This newly revamped Gyrocopter has attached enough armaments to assault in a 360 degree radius.
language.aghanimDescription: Adds a Side Gunner that at random attacks enemy units near Gyrocopter. When Flak Cannon is active, side gunner attacks 2 units instead. Prioritizes furthest unit away within its range.
notes: Attack range for the primary attack is unchanged.

description: Call down 3 aerial missile strikes that slow and damage enemy units in a target area. Each strike is 500 distance from the previous one and is delayed by 1.0s
language.lore: 'Bombs Away!'
notes: The visual indicator is visible to allies only.

description: Sprays high-pressure acid across a target area. Enemy units who step across the contaminated terrain take damage per second and have their armor reduced.
language.lore: Using traditional Alchemy from the Darkbrew family, Razzil concocts an acid that dissolves even the toughest metals.

description: Alchemist brews up an unstable concoction that he can throw at an enemy hero, to stun and deal damage in an area around the explosion. The longer the concoction brews, the more damage it deals and the longer the stun. Alchemist is faster while charging the concoction. After 5.0 seconds, the brew reaches its maximum damage and stun time. However, after 5.5 seconds, the concoction will explode on Alchemist himself if not thrown.
language.lore: A silver lining to the failure of turning a mountain into gold, this volatile solution has destructive potential.
notes: While brewing, this ability is replaced by Unstable Concoction Throw.  Alchemist can move and act normally while brewing.
A timer above Alchemist's head will indicate the remaining brew time. This timer is visible to enemies.
You can deny yourself with this skill.
Unstable Concoction cannot be disjointed and once thrown Unstable Concoction stops brewing.
Unstable Concoction explosion damages heroes and creeps.

description: Throw it before it blows up!

Alchemist synthesizes additional gold from his enemies and bounty runes. With each kill, Alchemist earns base bonus gold and extra bonus gold. If Alchemist kills another unit which yields gold within the next 36 seconds, an additional instance of Extra Bonus Gold is added to the total. Additionally, causes bounty runes to yield more gold.
language.lore: While it is not a mountain, Razzil has mastered the conversion of smaller compounds to line his pockets.

description: Alchemist causes his Ogre to enter a chemically induced rage, reducing base attack cooldown and increasing movement speed and health regeneration.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: The brew Razzil gave to the Ogre during their prison bust has become a useful potion in the midst of combat.
language.aghanimDescription: Alchemist melts down Aghanim's Scepter to grant an allied hero all Aghanim's Scepter upgrades. Alchemist will gain bonus damage and spell amplification for each gifted Scepter.
notes: Has a 0.35 second transformation time, which can be used to dodge projectiles and stuns.

description: Allows manipulation of ice elements. Passively grants + 1 Strength per level. Each <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font> instance imbues Invoker's spells with Spell Lifesteal.
notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.
Spell Lifesteal for the spell is calculated on cast. Changing orbs afterwards has no effect.

description: Allows manipulation of storm elements. Passively grants + 1 Agility per level. Each <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font> instance provides increased cooldown reduction and movement speed.
notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.

description: Allows manipulation of fire elements. Passively grants + 1 Intelligence per level. Each <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font> instance imbues Invoker's spells with Spell Amplification.
notes: Invoker can only have 3 of any instance.
Spell Amplification for the spell is calculated on cast. Changing orbs afterwards has no effect.

description: Casting Invoke will replace this slot with one of ten unique spells based on Invoker's currently active <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>, <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>, and <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font> buffs.

Casting Invoke will replace this slot with one of ten unique spells based on Invoker's currently active <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>, <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>, and <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font> buffs.

Combines the properties of the elements currently being manipulated to create a new spell for Invoker to use. Invoke cooldown is reduced by 0.3 seconds for each orb level.

Click the help button to see the list of possible spells.
language.lore: So begins a new age of knowledge.
notes: The arrangement of instances does not matter.
Invoke will not cost mana or go on cooldown if the only effect is to swap the positions of existing spells.

description: Invoker draws the heat from an enemy, chilling them to their very core for a duration based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>. The enemy will take damage and be briefly frozen. Further damage taken in this state will freeze the enemy again, dealing bonus damage and healing invoker. The enemy can only be frozen so often, but the freeze cooldown decreases based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>.
language.lore: Sadron's Protracted Frisson.
notes: The freeze stun only triggers on damage greater than 10.0 after reductions.

description: Curses the target area, dealing damage and causing enemy heroes to take damage over time and slowing their movement speed. Silenced enemies take 1.5x slow and damage. Anytime affected enemies cast a spell, the duration is increased. The duration is paused as long as the target is silenced.
language.lore: Nortrom's lack of incantations is less of a problem for him than it is for his adversaries.
notes: Affects creeps.

description: Silencer enchants his glaives with his wisdom, dealing additional damage based on his Intelligence. Silencer temporarily steals his target's Intelligence with each hit. If Silencer kills an enemy hero, he permanently steals 2 Intelligence.
language.lore: Although lacking in traditional incantations, Nortrom's pedigree of the Aeol Drias gives him uncanny wisdom, which he applies to physical combat.
notes: To permanently steal Intelligence, Silencer doesn't need to land the killing blow, as long as the enemy hero is killed within 925 range of Silencer.
The enemy does not need to have the Glaives of Wisdom debuff for Silencer to permanently steal Intelligence.
language.shardDescription: Every 0 attacks, Glaives silence the enemy hit for 0 seconds. Additionally, it increases the Intelligence stolen per attack by 2 and per kill to 2.

description: Enchants a target, providing vision of them and causing them to be damaged and silenced if they cast a spell or if the enchantment timer expires. Deals extra damage based on the difference in intelligence between Silencer and the target.
language.lore: Nortrom ensures that spells uttered by his opponents will be their last.
language.aghanimDescription: Causes Last Word to become an AoE ability.
notes: Channeling abilities will trigger this effect once the caster finishes its channel.

description: Silencer stops all sound, preventing enemy heroes and units on the map from casting spells.
language.lore: With a shock to the ground, all magic and sound pauses, and Nortrom fulfills his prophecy.
notes: This skill works on invisible and Debuff Immune units, but gaining debuff immunity will remove its effect.

description: Invoker manipulates the ice and electrical energies around him, rendering his body invisible and gaining health and mana regen. The elemental imbalance created as a consequence slows nearby enemies based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>, and slows Invoker as well based on the level of <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>.
language.lore: Myrault's Hinder-Gast.
notes: The slow effect does not work on Spell Immune enemies.

description: Unleashes a fast moving tornado that picks up enemy units in its path, suspending them helplessly in the air shortly before allowing them to plummet to their doom. Travels further based on the level of <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>. Holds enemies in the air for a duration based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>. Deals base damage plus added damage based on levels in <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: Claws of Tornarus.
notes: Units are invulnerable while affected by Tornado, and the damage is dealt when landing.

description: Invoker builds up a charge of electromagnetic energy at a targeted location which automatically detonates after 2.9 seconds. The detonation covers an area, draining mana based on the level of <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>. Deals damage for each point of mana drained. If EMP drains mana from an enemy hero, Invoker gains 25% of the mana drained.
language.lore: Endoleon's Malevolent Perturbation.
notes: Will not affect cycloned units (Tornado or Eul's Scepter of Divinity).
language.shardDescription: Increases damage for each point of mana drained by EMP and pulls enemy units into the EMP's center at 175 units per second.

description: Invoker infuses an ally with an immense surge of energy, increasing their attack speed based on the level of <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font> and their damage based on the level of <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font>.
language.lore: Gaster's Mandate of Impetuous Strife.

description: Invoker pulls a flaming meteor from space onto the targeted location. Upon landing, the meteor rolls forward, constantly dealing damage based on the level of <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font>, and rolling further based on the level of <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>. Units hit by the meteor will also be set on fire for a short time, receiving additional damage based on the level of <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font>.
language.lore: Tarak's Descent of Fire.
notes: Deals main damage to enemy units under meteor every 0.5 seconds and burns enemies for smaller damage over 3.0 seconds.
The meteor moves at a speed of 300.
language.shardDescription: Causes %bonus_meteor_count% extra Chaos Meteors to land alongside the primary cast at slight angles. Reduces cooldown by %bonus_AbilityCooldown% seconds.

description: Sends a catastrophic ray of fierce energy from the sun at any targeted location, incinerating all enemies standing beneath it once it reaches the earth. Deals damage based on the level of <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font>, however this damage is spread evenly over all enemies hit.
language.lore: Harlek's Incantation of Incineration.
language.aghanimDescription: Creates a Cataclysm when Sun Strike is double tapped. Puts it on a 100 second cooldown. Creates 0 visible Sun Strikes within 160-200 range of each enemy hero. Additionally Increases the level of Quas, Wex and Exort by 1.
notes: Gives vision of the target area before the strike.
Invoker gains experience with kills made from Sun Strike, even if made from outside of experience range.

description: Invoker forges a spirit embodying the strength of fire and fortitude of ice. Damage and armor are based on the level of <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font> while attack range, health, and duration are based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>. The elemental's scorching attack is capable of melting the armor of enemy heroes. Spawns two spirits when Quas and Exort are at least level 4.
language.lore: Culween's Most Cunning Fabrications.
notes: Casting this ability will replace currently summoned Forged Spirits.

description: Melts away the armor of heroes hit by the spirit's attack. Each successive hit increases the amount of armor melted.

Generates a wall of solid ice directly in front of Invoker for a duration based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>. The bitter cold emanating from it greatly slows nearby enemies based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font> and deals damage each second based on the level of <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font>.
language.lore: Killing Wall of Koryx.
language.shardDescription: Allows Ice Wall to be a Vector Target ability with 1100 cast range. Increases wall length by 320.

description: Invoker unleashes a mighty sonic wave in front of him, dealing damage to any enemy unit it collides with based on the level of <font color='#cabe68'>Exort</font>. The sheer impact from the blast is enough to knock those enemy units back for a duration based on the level of <font color='#7998b5'>Quas</font>, then disarm their attacks for a duration based on the level of <font color='#d671a9'>Wex</font>.
language.lore: Buluphont's Aureal Incapacitator.

description: Adds extra pure damage to Outworld Destroyer's attacks, based on his remaining mana pool.
language.lore: Harbinger's outworldly knowledge allows it to tap into the ebb and flow of all spiritual energy, infusing it into his being.
notes: The damage is calculated after the mana cost is spent.

description: Places a target unit into an astral prison. The hidden unit is invulnerable and disabled. When the astral prison implodes, it deals damage to the target and steals a percentage of their max mana.
language.lore: Locked away in the pocket between this world and the Outworld, victims realize their infantile knowledge and mortality.
notes: Imprisoned units can still be hit by Sanity's Eclipse.
Max mana steal does not increase Outworld Destroyer's current mana values or directly reduce the victim's mana values.
language.shardDescription: Grants additional Mana Capacity steal to Astral Imprisonment. Also allows allies to move at 0% movement speed during Astral Imprisonment (they are visible, but untargettable and can't perform any other actions).

description: Whenever nearby allied Heroes or Outworld Destroyer itself casts a spell, it gains a chance to restore a percentage of its mana pool.  Outworld Destroyer also passively gains a bonus to its base mana pool.  Several skills with no cooldown and toggled spells cannot trigger Essence Aura.
language.lore: The crystals of the Outworld produce arcane power, and the Harbinger channels it into the world of mortals.
notes: Other than Arcane Orb, most skills without cooldowns cannot trigger Essence Aura.

description: Unleashes a psychic blast that deals damage to enemies based on the difference between your mana and the target's mana. Sanity's Eclipse can hit units trapped by Astral Imprisonment. Deals bonus damage to illusions. Affected Heroes gain a Mana Allergy Debuff for 7 seconds, receiving damage and healing Outworld Destroyer every time they cast a spell.
language.lore: When an Outworld crystal ruptures, cataclysmic energies are released, and the reverberations of this power are felt interdimensionally.
notes: Does not damage creeps or neutral units.

description: Summons two wolves to fight for Lycan.  Level 3-4 wolves have Permanent Invisibility, and level 4 wolves have Cripple that gives 20% chance to cripple the target, causing 8 damage per second and lose 60 attack speed for 4 seconds.
language.lore: The very enchantment that twisted his being also summons canine familiars.
notes: Spirit Wolves have 70% magic damage resistance.
Using this spell will replace currently active Spirit Wolves.
language.shardDescription: Causes one of your creep waves to include one uncontrollable wolf that moves with the wave. Additionally, wolves spawned this way may Cripple towers.

description: Strikes fear into enemies, reducing armor and attack damage of all enemies within 2000 range of Lycan and his wolves. Non-hero controlled units flee for a short time. At night Howl's armor and attack damage reductions are global.
language.lore: Blood-curdling wolf cries signal to opponents that Banehallow is among them.

description: Increases the HP regeneration and damage of Lycan and all units under his control.
language.lore: His animalistic symbiosis with canine kind gives Banehallow enhanced reflexes and hunting capabilities.

description: Lycan assumes his lupine form, granting him and his units critical strikes and added vision at night. During Shapeshift, Lycan and all units under his control move at increased speed, cannot be slowed and have a 40% chance to deal a critical strike doing 160 / 190 / 220% damage.
language.lore: Forever a slave to his lycanthropy, Banehallow has come to accept his curse, and embrace his own savagery.
notes: Hex doesn't remove Lycan's movement speed.
Lycan has a smaller collision size in this state.

description: Gives 20% to cripple the target, causing 8 damage per second and lose 60 Attack Speed for 4.0 seconds.
Slams the ground, dealing damage and slowing the movement speed and attack rate of nearby enemy units.
language.lore: A slam of Mangix' mighty keg starts the festivities.

description: Drenches a target in alcohol, causing their movement speed to be reduced, and causing their attacks to have a chance to miss.
language.lore: The Order of the Oyo's solution to all problems - another round!
notes: Can be disjointed.

description: Brewmaster can switch stances based on the elements he controls, gaining passive bonuses that improve against enemies when Brewed Up.
<font color=\"#9acd32\">Earth Brawler</font> - Grants 1 / 3 / 5 / 7 armor and 5 / 10 / 15 / 20 Magic Resistance. Bonuses are 2.5x when Brewed Up.
<font color=\"#87ceeb\">Storm Brawler</font> - Grants 15 / 20 / 25 / 30 evasion and 5 / 7 / 9 / 11% Bonus Move Speed. Bonuses are 2.5x when Brewed Up.

<font color=\"#FF0000\">Fire Brawler</font> - Grants 20 chance to critical strike for 120 / 140 / 160 / 180 of your attack damage and 10 / 15 / 20 / 25 Attack Speed. Crit Chance and Attack Speed is 2.5x when Brewed Up.

<font color=\"#662375\">Void Brawler</font> - Grants 5 / 10 / 15 / 20% bonus Status Resistance to Brewmaster and applies a 10 / 15 / 20 / 25 Slow for 2s on attack. Slow and Status Resistance are 2.5x when affected by Cinder Brew.
language.lore: When Mangix won his title as the Brewmaster of the Order of Oyo, he also claimed his place in the mastery of inebriation.
notes: Stacks diminishingly with other sources of Evasion.

description: Splits Brewmaster into elements, forming 4 specialized warriors, adept at survival, each with their own abilities. If any of them survive until the end of their summoned timer, the Brewmaster is reborn.
language.lore: It isn't clear whether Mangix is consciously aware of his potent bond with nature, as it often occurs in the midst of a drunken stupor.
language.aghanimDescription: Primal Split has 2 charges and can be canceled at any time. Charge replenish time is equal to the normal cooldown.
notes: The Earth Element will carry all auras that the Brewmaster has, as well as True Sight.
The Fire Element has phased movement.
When the spell ends, Brewmaster will take the place of an element in this order, assuming they are alive: Earth, Storm, Fire.
language.shardDescription: Increases Primal Split duration and allows it to be cancelled early.

description: Throws a boulder at a unit, doing damage and stunning it.
Immune to debuffs. Magic resistance increased by 50%.
Deals bonus damage to buildings.

Tidehunter attaches a heavy anchor to an enemy hero. The hero is leashed while attached to the anchor. Attempting to move more than 350 units away from the anchor forces the hero to 100 move speed, dragging the anchor behind them. The anchor can be destroyed with 4 hero attacks.
Damages summoned units in an area and dispels most buffs or debuffs.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Can be cast on invulnerable units.

description: Encloses a unit in a tornado, removing it from the battlefield.
Provides temporary invisibility.  Bonus movement speed and attack damage when invisible.
Burns nearby enemy units.

Summons a powerful Spirit Bear companion that can equip items. If the bear moves 1100 distance away from the Lone Druid, it cannot attack. Lone Druid suffers 20.0% of his max health as backlash damage if the Spirit Bear dies.
Spirit Bear has the Return, Demolish and Entangling Claws abilities.
language.lore: Sylla's lifelong companion is symbiotic with his spirit and heart, coming to aid him in any time of need.
notes: Most spells interact with the Spirit Bear in the same way as they do with heroes.
Spirit Bear has 0 base attributes and does not gain them with level. Attributes from buffs or items fully affect the bear as they would for Universal heroes.
Spirit Bear cannot gain experience. Spirit Bear health and damage increase by 90 and 5 respectively with Lone Druid's level.
Spirit Bear has its own Aghanim's Scepter and Shard upgrades.

description: Increases the attack and movement speed of Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear.
language.lore: Bears are not commonly seen as being agile creatures, but can actually move rather quickly, especially when enraged.

description: Lone Druid and the Spirit Bear roar fiercely causing nearby enemies to flee towards their base in terror. Their movement speed is increased by 20%.
language.lore: Sylla studies and masters the arts of the lost Bear Clan, enhancing his attunement with the wild.
notes: An entangled hero will not be able to move.
Cooldown is shared with Spirit Bear.
language.shardDescription:
Applies a basic dispel and grants allies in an area around the caster bonus movement and attack speed. Replicates between Lone Druid and Spirit Bear regardless of castability on the other.

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel

description: Lone Druid learns to morph himself into a raging bear, losing his ranged advantage, but gaining increased bonus armor and health, and improved versions of Entangling Claws and Demolish.
language.lore: The mighty bear is the king of the forest, possessing the throne through raw power.
notes: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Lone Druid was in when the item was used.

description: Return to Druid form.
Adds attack damage and armor to the Lone Druid as well as any nearby units under his control.
language.lore: When Sylla cries in the forest, the reverberations are felt for a great distance.

description: Channels for 3 seconds and then teleports the Spirit Bear back to the Lone Druid.
language.aghanimDescription: Allows Spirit Bear to attack at any range from Lone Druid, and to survive if Lone Druid dies.

description: Attacks have a chance to cause roots to burst from the ground, immobilizing the attacked enemy unit, and dealing damage per second.
notes: Entangled units can't use Blink abilities, and are revealed if they are invisible.

description: Increases the power of the Spirit Bear, causing it to deal more damage to buildings and have additional magic resistance.
Banishes the targeted unit from the battlefield for a short duration.  Upon returning, two illusions of the banished unit with bonus base damage are created under Shadow Demon's control.
language.lore: The pain of deception comes not while it happens, but when it is revealed.

description: Captures the soul of enemy units in an area, causing them to lose a percentage of their current health. Shadow Demon temporarily gains Spell Amplification for each hero's soul captured. When the debuff is removed, the units gain half of the lost health back. Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Soul Catcher.
language.lore: Trying to resist the Shadow Demon's corruption is mostly a useless endeavor.

description: Deals damage in a line, and afflicts enemy units with a poison effect. The poison deals 1/2/4/8/16 times the stack damage based on the number of stacks on the target, up to 5 stacks. Additional stacks cause 50 damage each. This deferred damage is dealt when Shadow Poison's duration is expired, or the Release sub-ability is used.
language.lore: The ever growing influence of the Shadow Demon can pollute the most valiant and pure of heroes.
notes: Shadow Poison can affect units under Disruption.

description: Releases the poison to do damage on all affected enemies. Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Shadow Poison.

Purges the target enemy unit, removing positive buffs, and slowing the target for the duration.  The unit slowly regains its speed until the end of the duration, upon which damage is dealt.  Units under the effect of Disruption can still be affected by Demonic Purge.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: Once Shadow Demon no longer has any need for his collected cultist, he releases it from its subservience - and its life.
language.aghanimDescription: Cooldown is removed, replaced with 2 charges that replenish every 60 seconds. Also causes Demonic Purge to break its target's passive abilities while active.
notes: The slow starts at 100.0% and decreases over time to 20.0%.
Positive buffs are continously removed from the target for the duration of the Purge.
Can be cast on invulnerable units.

description: Throws a mysterious bolt of energy at the target unit. It stuns for a random duration and deals random damage.
language.lore: Even Chaos Knight cannot predict this manifest of unholy energy.
notes: The stun duration and damage values dealt are inversely related.
Nearby illusions will mimic the cast animation.
language.shardDescription: Increases  the cast range of Chaos Bolt, and causes it to create a Phantasm illusion to attack the target.

description: Teleports Chaos Knight, any illusions he has, and the target unit to a point along the line between him and the target. Reduces armor of the enemy unit for 6 seconds.
language.lore: Armageddon rides between the planes, bringing Chaos Knight to his victim wherever he may hide.
notes: Chaos Knight and the target unit are made to face each other, and Chaos Knight and his phantasms are issued an attack order against the target.
language.shardDescription: Allows Reality Rift to be cast on any enemy hero that is within 1200 range of you or one of your illusions. Gathers all of your illusions and your hero and teleports them to the target enemy.

description: Chaos Knight and his illusions' attacks have a chance to deal a critical strike of varying strength with bonus lifesteal. Deals 1.9x damage to creeps, but lifesteal from creeps is reduced by 70%.
language.lore: Chaos Knight's unwieldy power bludgeons those who stand before him, crushing the thickest of armors.

description: Summons several phantasmal copies of the Chaos Knight from alternate dimensions. The phantasms are strong illusions that deal 100% damage, but take 325% damage.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: Drawing on his battles fought across many worlds and many times, phantasms of the Chaos Knight rise up to quell all who oppose him.
language.aghanimDescription: Creates an illusion of allied heroes globally. Creates an additional illusion for Chaos Knight as well.
notes: Removes most negative buffs from Chaos Knight.
Chaos Knight is invulnerable for 0.5 seconds when casting, allowing him to dodge stuns and damage.
Strong Illusions are not instantly killed by spells.

description: Tosses a net at the target point, rooting down all enemy units in an area around it.
language.lore: Catching dinner in the Riftshadow Ruins can be quite the task.
notes: Affects invisible units, revealing them.
Does not work on Debuff Immune units or Roshan.

description:
Drawing mystical energies from the earth, a Meepo can teleport to another Meepo or itself after channeling for %abilitycastpoint% seconds, damaging the enemy in both the departure and arrival locations.

If the ability is in alt-cast state, all Meepos will also cast Poof to the target. When cast on the ground, all Meepos except the selected one will Poof to the closest location.
language.lore: Sometimes breaking one of the Riftshadow Crystals can be just the trick for getting yourself out of a bind.  Or your other self.
notes: Can be cast through the minimap.
Can teleport to Meepo illusions.

language.lore: Keeping your pack light and having few but versatile tools is the best bet for survival.

description: Meepo summons an imperfect, semi-autonomous duplicate of himself, which can gain gold and experience as he does and shares his experience, attributes and abilities. However, the clones cannot wield any items but the boots that Meepo himself wears.  If any of the clones die, they all die. Divided We Stand grants all Meepos bonus Magic Resistance.
language.lore: Do I know you?
notes: Clones can't use Arcane Boots, Guardian Greaves.
language.shardDescription: Divided We Stand can be cast as long as there's a Meepo within %fling_radius% radius of yourself. Causes that Meepo to fling you towards a target within a %AbilityCastRange% range, dealing damage and slowing their movement speed. Mana Cost: %AbilityManaCost%

description: Provides Treant with Tree Walking whenever he hasn't taken damage for 3 seconds. While nearby trees or affected by Nature's Grasp, Treant gains bonus movement speed.
language.lore: The Protectors don't often come into vision; their natural state being nestled within their leafy brethren.
notes: While affected by Nature's Guise, Treant can move unobstructed through other trees.
language.shardDescription: Causes Treant to move faster and become invisible with Nature's Guise and root enemies upon attacking. Deals damage over time and roots for longer if the attack was near a tree.

description: Treant plants a life-sapping seed in an enemy unit, draining its health, while simultaneously slowing it. The seed heals friendly units around it.
language.lore: Rooftrellen nurtures the beings under his stewardship, sustained by the lifeforce of trespassers into his sacred ground.

description: Infuses the target hero or structure with a protective coating which heals the target and provides bonus armor.
language.lore: The roots and tendrils of the Treant Protectors are far-reaching, stimulating the growth and rejuvenation of all of nature.

description: Summons an overgrowth of vines and branches around Treant that deal damage to afflicted enemies and prevent them from moving, blinking, going invisible, or attacking.
language.lore: Rooftrellen calls the ancestral spirit of nature, releasing its power through all of his kin.
notes: Works on Debuff Immune units, but if units gain debuff immunity after the effect starts, they'll break free.

description: Blasts an enemy unit with a wave of fire, dealing damage and stunning the target.
language.lore: The Ogre Magi is easily amused, entertained for hours by playing with fire.
notes: When Multicast, Fireblast hits the same target each time with a 0.6 seconds interval.

description: Drenches the target and another random unit in volatile chemicals, causing it to burst into flames. The target is in immense pain, taking damage and moving more slowly.
language.lore: Batter up!
notes: Multicast makes this spell have a chance to cast multiple times at random enemy units in a 1400 area of effect.
Ignite hitting an already affected unit adds to the burn duration.

description: Incites a frenzy in a friendly unit, increasing its movement speed and attack speed. Gives bonus attacks speed if cast on Ogre himself. Can be cast on towers.
language.lore: 'Running's not as fun as hitting... Not one bit fun.'
notes: When multicast, nearby allies will be selected randomly in an 700 area of effect to receive Bloodlust.

description: Enables Ogre Magi to cast his abilities and items multiple times with each use.
language.lore: Despite being largely incapacitated by his IQ, the Ogre Magi's success in battle is attributed to pure skill.
notes: Only targeted abilities and items have a chance to be multicast.
Targeted abilities and items apply to additional enemies and neutrals in an AoE around Ogre. Fireblast and Unrefined Fireblast hit the same target multiple times.

description: Undying steals strength from all enemy heroes in an area, dealing base damage as he claims the enemy's strength for himself. Deals 2.0x damage to creeps.
language.lore: The strength of the living is simply borrowed from the strength of the dead.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases strength steal.
notes: The strength stolen stacks, but can't cause a hero to have strength below 1.
The strength steal takes effect before the damage is dealt.
Affects invisible units.

description: Undying rips health away from all nearby units and uses it to heal an ally, or damage an enemy. Soul Rip can also be used to heal Tombstone.
language.lore: Even allies feel despair in Undying's presence.
notes: Can heal Tombstone, but can't heal or damage other buildings.
Does not rip from invisible units, invulnerable units, units in the fog of war, or spell immune enemies.
Does rip from spell immune allies, including zombies.

description: Summons a tombstone at the target point.  Zombies will frequently spawn next to every enemy unit in the area around the Tombstone, and attack them.  Zombies have the Deathlust ability, which causes their attacks to slow the target, and if the target reaches below a certain amount of health, increases the attack and movement speed of the zombie.
language.lore: Dirge calls on his fallen brothers to fight for the Dead God.
notes: Tombstone is Spell Immune, but can be healed by Soul Rip.
Zombies and Tombstone are Spell Immune.
If their initial target dies or goes out of vision, the Zombie will die.
language.shardDescription: Tombstone can be cast on an allied hero to bunker inside of the tombstone. Heroes that enter the Tombstone cannot leave for 3 seconds nor can they re-enter after leaving. If the tombstone is destroyed with a hero inside, that hero gets stunned for 2 seconds.

description: Slows enemy units on attack.  If the attacked unit's health goes below the threshold, the zombie receives enhanced movement and attack speed.
Undying transforms into a horrifying flesh golem. Gains a percentage increase to strength and imbues attacks with a slow and damage amplification.
language.lore: The flesh of the recently dead add to the power of Dirge's plague.

description: Rubick uses his telekinetic powers to lift the enemy into the air briefly and then hurls them back at the ground. The unit lands on the ground with such force that it stuns nearby enemies.
language.lore: Even the Grandest Magus may use his powers for enjoyment.
notes: While the target is in the air, Rubick may use a secondary ability to throw the enemy in a targeted direction.
When the unit lands, it isn't affected by the area of effect stun.
language.shardDescription: Allows you to target yourself or allies with Telekinesis. Throw range is 35 longer and throw delay is reduced to 0.5 seconds.

description: Chooses the location the target will land when Telekinesis finishes.
Rubick creates a powerful stream of arcane energy that travels between enemy units, dealing damage and reducing their attack damage. Each jump deals less damage.
language.lore: Rubick's favorite spell for dispatching would-be assassins is a rather simple conjuration.

description: Rubick's mastery of the arcane creates an aura that nullifies nearby enemy senses or increases his own. Can be toggled offensively or defensively to reduce enemy magic resistance or increase allied magic resistance.
language.lore: Not every magus can be a Grand Magus...
notes: Stacks multiplicatively with other spell resistance sources.

description: Rubick studies the trace magical essence of one enemy hero, learning the secrets of the last spell the hero cast. Rubick can use this spell as his own for several minutes or until he dies, and stolen spells last longer on enemies.
language.lore: ...but even their lesser magics can be a source of much utility.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases the number of spells that can be stolen to 2. Increases cast range, and upgrades spells to their Scepter version.
notes: Cannot steal item abilities.
Rubick will steal the Aghanim's Shard version of the ability, if he himself has an Aghanim's Shard.

description: Spells acquired with Spell Steal will replace this slot.
Spells acquired with Spell Steal will replace this slot.

Repeatedly strikes the targeted unit with lightning. Each strike damages nearby enemy units in a small radius and slows enemy movement and attack speed by 100% for 0.1 / 0.2 / 0.3 / 0.4 seconds. Provides vision of its target.
language.lore: Disruptor's charged coils occasionally overload, and a singed armor plate or tuft of fur is the enemy's result.
language.shardDescription: Increases the cast range and strike count of Thunder Strike. It can now also be ground targeted, where it will lie dormant for up to 7 seconds and attach to the first enemy that comes within the radius.

description: Teleports the target hero back to where it was 4 seconds ago. Instantly kills illusions. Deals damage based on distance glimpsed, with max damage dealt at 1400 distance.
language.lore: Playing with electricity can have unexpected results.
notes: The travel time is a function of the distance the target will travel.

description: After a short formation time, creates a circular barrier of kinetic energy that enemies can't pass.
language.lore: The stryder is immune to the gale-force winds that will consume its adversaries.
notes: Debuff Immune units can travel through the field.

description: Creates a damaging static storm that also silences all enemy units in the area for the duration.  The damage starts off weak, but increases in power over the duration.
language.lore: A summer squall in Druud is a hardship that only an Oglodi can survive.
language.aghanimDescription: Mutes items.

description: Rock spikes burst from the earth along a straight path. Enemy units take damage, then are hurled into the air and stunned.
language.lore: All zealot scarabs possess intimate knowledge of underground pathways, using them to their advantage.
notes: The spikes move at 1600 units per second, over 750 range.
Impale cannot be blocked by Linken's Sphere.

description: Destroys the target hero's mana equal to a multiplier of its Intelligence, and deals damage equal to the mana burned.
language.lore: The tome in Ultimyr describes one scarab with the ability eat away at the mind of lesser beings.

description: When activated while above ground, Spiked Carapace reflects and negates damage dealt to Nyx Assassin (max once from each source), as well as stunning the source of the damage. Activating Spiked Carapace will not break Vendetta invisibility.
While Burrowed, Spiked Carapace instantly stuns nearby enemies when cast.
language.lore: While their carapace is relatively thin, it's guarded by a retractable field of razor-sharp spikes.
notes: The damage is calculated after all reductions.
Spiked Carapace will only trigger on damage from other player controlled units.
The damage reflected will have the same damage type as it had when it was dealt to Nyx.

description: Allows Nyx Assassin to become invisible and gain a speed bonus. If Nyx Assassin attacks to break the invisibility, 50 of the target's max mana is removed and massive bonus damage is dealt with the attack. Nyx Assassin has 75 additional attack range and a 70% faster attack animation for this attack.
language.lore: The scarab kills for the glory of his queen.
notes: Has a 0.0 second fadetime.
If a spell is used to break the invisibility, or the invisibility expires, the bonus damage is lost.
language.shardDescription: Vendetta now moves faster, and a successful Vendetta attack now increases the target's spell damage taken.

description: Blasts an enemy unit with a wave of fire, dealing 150 + 1.5x Ogre's Strength in damage and stunning the target. Its mana cost is 35% of Ogre Magi's current mana.
language.lore: The 'who-casts-spell-first' argument between himself is solved simply by both casting at once.
notes: When Multicast, Unrefined Fireblast hits the same target each time with a 0.6 seconds interval.

description: Creates multiple images of Naga Siren under her control.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: Slithice, while being strong in her own right, is notoriously hard to track down.
notes: Naga Siren is invulnerable for 0.5 seconds when casting, allowing her to dodge stuns and damage.
Upon casting, most effects are removed from Naga Siren.
Upon casting, existing Mirror Image illusions are destroyed.

description: Interrupts the target and traps them in place, preventing movement or blinking.
language.lore: The only way to escape the onslaught of a Slithereen is to never oppose one in the first place.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases cast range and projectile speed.  Allows Ensnare to target Spell Immune or sleeping units.

description: Every 6 attacks from naga and her illusions, the Naga Siren and her images will hit all nearby units with a damaging wave of water that lowers armor for 4.0 seconds.
language.lore: A torrent from the Deep Ones crushes the defenses of the Siren's enemies.

description: All enemies in range of the Naga Siren are put into a magical stasis where they cannot act or be attacked. Using Song of the Siren again will end the duration early.
language.lore: Slithice's powerful voice enchants leagues of opponents, while calling her Slithereen kin in a time of need.
notes: Units affected by Song of the Siren are invulnerable and cannot take damage from any source.
Doesn't affect Debuff Immune units.
The area of the song follows Naga, so if she moves far enough away from affected units, they will wake up.
language.shardDescription: Increases duration. Song of the Siren heals allies by 0 of their Max HP per second for its duration.

description: CHANNELED - Channels light energy, building power the longer it's channeled.  Once released, a wave is sent forth that deals damage and gives vision in its path.  The longer it is channeled, the more damage is dealt.
language.lore: Ezalor's hidden light reveals itself in marvelous fashion.
notes: Gives increasing vision over the channeling time.
language.shardDescription: Causes Illuminate to heal for 40% of its damage during daytime.

description: Weakens an enemy's magical essence, causing them to lose mana as they move.  If the enemy loses all of its mana, it will be stunned.
language.lore: Ezalor disrupts Primordial harmony, draining magical energy from those with poor constitution.
notes: If the target travels over 300 distance in less than 0.1 second (by using blink skills, for example), Mana Leak will not decrease its mana for that distance.

description: Restores mana to the target unit and reduces cooldowns of all basic abilities currently on cooldown by a fixed amount. Is 25% more effective when used on himself.
language.lore: In the same vein, Ezalor bestows his harmony among others.
notes: Chakra Magic does not reduce the cooldown of Ultimate abilities

description: Ezalor temporarily turns his body luminescent, gaining bonus movement speed, cast range, grants the Solar Bind ability, and allows Illuminate to be channeled by a separate spirit and heal allies.
language.lore: In a flash of light, Ezalor reveals his true nature.

description: After a short delay, teleports the targeted friendly hero to your location.  If the targeted friendly hero takes player based damage during this time, the ability is interrupted. Chakra Magic is applied to both Keeper of the Light and Ally upon teleporting
language.lore: Walk towards the light.
notes: If Keeper of the Light dies, the spell effect is interrupted.
Recall will interrupt channeling spells.
You can disable help to prevent Keeper from casting this spell on you.
Can be cast through the minimap, choosing the nearest friendly hero.

description: A blinding light flashes over the targeted area, knocking back and blinding the units in the area, causing them to miss some attacks. Knockback is 400 range over 0.6 seconds.
language.lore: The Primordial light turns the tides of battle in favor of Ezalor and his allies.
notes: Upon landing, units will destroy trees in a 150 radius.

description: Release the channel early.
Release enemy units from your song so they can be targeted again.

Channels light energy, building power the longer it's channeled.  Once released, a wave is sent forth that deals damage and gives vision in its path.  The longer it is channeled, the more damage is dealt.
language.lore: Ezalor's hidden light reveals itself in marvelous fashion.
notes: Gives increasing vision over the channeling time.

description: Visage drains the movement and attack speed of the targeted unit, gaining it for itself and nearby familiars.
language.lore: The warmth of the sun is never felt in the dark cold of the Narrow Maze.
notes: The two buffs can be removed separately by dispels.
The speed gained is independent of the speed lost on the target.
Familiars within 900 range of Visage will also receive bonuses from Grave Chill.

description: Visage gathers charges of soul essence each time nearby heroes take more than 100 damage. When the essence is released, it deals base damage as well as damage for each gathered soul charge.
language.lore: The collected souls of the dead reach out to bring another into their fold.
notes: Charges are only gained for damage greater than 2.0 and less than 3000.0 that is dealt by a player or Roshan. Self-damage or Soul Assumption damage isn't counted.

description: Visage generates a layered barrier that protects him from damage.  If he receives damage from a player, one layer is removed, and takes time to recover.
language.lore: Visage's tough scales share equal properties of ghost and stone, making it nearly impervious to blade and magical assault.
notes: Each time Visage receives damage greater than the Minimum Damage that was not self-inflicted and was from a player owned source, a layer is removed.
Familiars within 900 range of Visage will receive the current damage reduction from Gravekeeper's Cloak.
language.shardDescription: Grants Visage the ability to cast Gravekeeper's Cloak. Restores up to 25 of your health.

description: Conjures blind Familiars to fight for Visage.  Familiars possess the Stone Form ability, that allows them to turn into stone, stunning enemies upon landing.  While in Stone Form, Familiars are invulnerable, and rapidly regenerate their health.  Familiars grant high bounty when killed.
language.lore: Guardians of the Narrow Maze, Necro'lic's Familiars stand watch over his domain.
notes: Casting Summon Familiars will replace any existing Familiars.
Familiars within range of Visage will receive bonuses from Gravekeeper's Cloak and Grave Chill.

description: After a short delay, the Familiar turns into stone and smashes into the ground, stunning and damaging all targets in the area. The Familiar becomes invulnerable, and will regain its health very rapidly. After 6.0 seconds, the Familiar will automatically leave Stone Form.

Tethers Io to an allied unit, granting bonus movement speed to both. When Io restores health or mana, the tethered unit gains a portion of that amount. The tether breaks when the allied unit moves too far away, or Io cancels the tether. Tether slows and damages enemies touching it.
language.lore: The benevolent touch of Io brings strength from between the planes.
notes: If you try to tether a unit that is 700 distance or further away from Io, he will latch on and pull himself closer to the tethered unit (to a distance of 300).
The tethered unit will heal faster and will heal even if Io is at full health.
Io's movement speed matches the tethered unit's.
language.shardDescription: Tether stuns enemies touching it for 1.75 seconds and deals 150 damage. Does not affect the same unit more than once every 7 seconds. Increases movement speed bonus by 8%.

description: Summon five particle spirits that dance in a circle around Io. If a particle collides with an enemy hero, it explodes, damaging all enemy units in an area around it.  Creeps take minor damage from touching a particle spirit, but do not cause them to explode.  When its duration ends, any remaining Spirits explode.
language.lore: Io twists the particles of the universe with its unimaginable capabilities.
language.aghanimDescription: Spirits now passively spawn around Io constantly every second up to the max. Spirits colliding with enemy Heroes slows them briefly. Can be activated to explode spirits.
notes: After summoning, Io can call the spirits in and out.

description: Io gains bonus attack speed, spell amplification, and HP Regen based on max health.  If Io is Tethered to an ally, that unit also gains the bonuses.
language.lore: Drawing on the energy of matter from all worlds, Io begins the unravelling of time.
language.shardDescription: Grants Overcharge Slow Resistance. Io also gains Spell Lifesteal and can now share Spell Lifesteal with its tethered target.

description: Teleports Io and a tethered ally to any location. After the spell expires, Io and the tethered ally will return to their original location. Double-click to teleport to your team's base fountain.
language.lore: Io is the embodiment of the mystery of the universe.
notes: Enemies receive a visual indicator in the world and on the minimap of the target location during the cast delay.
If Io is disabled during the cast delay, Relocate is cancelled.
If an allied hero is Tethered, that hero will teleport along with you. You can break the tether at any time to prevent that hero from teleporting with you.
Only heroes, creep heroes, and illusions can be relocated.

description: Break the link to the tethered unit.
Sends the spirits closer to you. Can be toggled on and off.
Provides bonus mana regeneration to all nearby allies.
Sends the courier to your team's secret shop
Sends the spirits farther away from you. Can be toggled on and off.
After a short delay, Slark sacrifices some of his life blood, purging most negative debuffs and dealing damage to enemy units around him and to himself. Slark only takes 30% of the damage.
DISPEL TYPE: Strong Dispel
language.lore: Slithereen are capable of quickly regrowing appendages, in case of critical injury, to save their own lives.
notes: 1.5% seconds after cast, a series of 10 pulses separated by 0.1 seconds deal the damage.
Each pulse also removes debuffs from Slark.
You can't kill yourself with this skill.
The pulses stop if Slark dies.

description: Slark leaps forward, leashing the first hero he connects with and applying Essence Shift Stacks.  That unit can only move a limited distance away from Slark's landing position.
language.lore: Time in the Dark Reef made Slark a dangerous assassin; aggressive and fearless.
language.aghanimDescription: Provides charges and increases range.
notes: On cast, Slark leaps forward at a speed of 933.33, stopping when he latches onto an enemy hero or has traveled 700 distance.
Debuff Immune units cannot be leashed.
Trees will be destroyed around Slark's landing location.

description: Slark steals the life essence of enemy heroes with his attacks, draining each of their attributes and converting them to bonus Agility. If Slark kills an affected enemy hero, he permanently steals 1 Agility.
language.lore: With each strike at his adversaries, Slark's knowledge of their weaknesses improves.
notes: Attributes cannot be dropped below 1.
Essence Shifted stats are returned to normal on death. The stat return for Slark and for the affected hero are separate.
To permanently steal Agility, Slark doesn't need to land the killing blow, as long as the enemy hero is killed within 300 range of Slark while having the Essence Shift debuff.

description: When used, Slark hides himself in a cloud of shadows, becoming immune to detection. Attacking, casting spells, and using items will not reveal Slark.  Passively, when not visible to the enemy team, Slark gains bonus movement speed and health regeneration.
language.lore: The hidden Thirteenth is a slippery foe.
notes: If Slark is damaged by a neutral unit, the passive movement and health regeneration bonuses are lost for 2.0 / 2.0 / 2.0 seconds.
The passive movement and health regeneration bonuses have a 0.5 / 0.5 / 0.5 second activation and deactivation delay.

description: Permanently invisible when not attacking.
Release the channel early.
Medusa magically splits her shot into several arrows. These arrows deal a lower percent of her normal damage.
The extra targets will not receive other attack effects (such as critical strike).
language.lore: All who encounter the cursed Gorgon will feel her rage.
notes: Secondary targets will be the closest enemy units excluding the primary target.
If illusions of Medusa are created while Split Shot is active, they will also have this ability.

description: A mystic snake made of energy jumps from target to target dealing damage. Damage and speed increases with each jump. After it reaches its last target, it returns to Medusa to replenish her with mana. The snake returns 14 / 15 / 16 / 17% mana based on the targets' total mana.
language.lore: The Gorgon's curse is her greatest strength.
language.aghanimDescription: Causes Mystic Snake to turn enemies hit into stone. Stone duration increases with each bounce of the Mystic Snake.
notes: Mystic Snake cannot be disjointed.

description: Creates a shield that absorbs 98% of incoming damage in exchange for Medusa's mana. Illusions absorb less damage per point of mana. Provides bonus mana capacity.
language.lore: While Medusa was not gifted with eternal life upon birth, her curse bestowed her with impressive defensive powers.
notes: Absorbs damage before any damage reduction takes place, meaning that armor will not reduce the amount of mana needed to absorb damage.

description: Any enemy units looking at Medusa will have their movement and attack speed slowed. If 2.0 seconds of total time is accumulated looking at Medusa while Stone Gaze is active, that unit will turn to stone. Petrified units are stunned, and take bonus physical attack damage.
language.lore: The beauty of Medusa is legendary.
notes: Regardless of when a unit receives the Stone Gaze buff while the ability is active on Medusa, it will still receive the full debuff duration.

description: While active, Troll Warlord swaps from using ranged to melee attacks. Melee attacks have a chance to ensnare, preventing the target from moving or using mobility spells. Berserker's Rage also grants additional movement speed, armor, and decreases base attack time.
Whirling Axes has different functionality while Berserker's Rage is active.
language.lore: Like his anger, Troll Warlord's supply of axes is infinite.
notes: Cooldowns of items that are different for ranged and melee units will be based on which form Troll Warlord was in when the item was used.

description: Troll hurls a fistful of five axes in a cone shape over 950.0 range, slowing and damaging enemy units.
language.lore: Only axes fueled by hate whirl with such a deadly spin.
language.aghanimDescription:
Causes Whirling Axes (Ranged) to dispel enemies. Reduces cooldown and mana cost.

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Does not affect Roshan.

description: Troll hurls two axes around him in a close range area of effect, damaging enemy units and causing them to miss some attacks.
language.lore: Keep your enemies close.
language.aghanimDescription:
Causes Whirling Axes (Melee) to dispel Troll Warlord. Reduces cooldown and mana cost.

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Does not affect Roshan.

description: With each continuous blow on the same target, Troll gains increased attack speed.  If Troll changes targets, the stacks drop to zero.
language.lore: If at first you don't succeed, strike, strike again.
language.shardDescription: Increases max Fervor stacks by %bonus_max_stacks% and grants Troll 20% + 4 chance per Fervor stack of firing an additional ranged attack to any unit within its ranged attack range plus 175.

description: Troll unleashes a powerful battle trance, that forces you to continuously attack the closest enemy unit within 900 range, prioritizing heroes. Damage does not kill you during this mode. Grants you bonus lifesteal, attack speed and movement speed. Applies a Basic Dispel.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
language.lore: An adrenaline rush of pure hatred quickens your blades.
notes: Troll can still use his items and abilities while affected by Battle Trance, but not other commands.
Troll can still be killed with Axe's Culling Blade.
Troll is granted vision over the target.
language.shardDescription: Casting Battle Trance now gives Troll Warlord a global aura that gives allied heroes (including himself) +60 Attack Speed.

description: After a brief windup, Centaur Warrunner slams the ground, stunning and damaging nearby enemy units. During the delay, he is disarmed but can move.
language.lore: When the mighty hoof of the Warrunner touches soil, the tremors are felt far and wide.

description: Centaur strikes a mighty blow at melee range, damaging both himself and a small area around the target. Deals extra damage based on your strength. Centaur cannot die from Double Edge.
language.lore: In the spurs of combat, Bradwarden's vicious strikes sometimes cause self-inflicted collateral damage.
notes: Double Edge deals magic type damage to both the targets and himself.
language.shardDescription: Causes Double Edge to slow enemy heroes and increase Centaur's strength per hero hit for a short time. Duration refreshes per stack, up to a max of  stacks.

description: Centaur counters all attacks, dealing damage back to the attacker. Returns a fixed amount plus a percentage of your strength. Deals half damage to towers.
language.lore: Bradwarden has no need to parry his opponent's attacks; his armor-like hide does it for him.
notes: Retaliate triggers when the attack hits.
Retaliate deals damage to towers.

description: Centaur leads all allies into a vicious charge causing them to move through units at max speed and slow any enemy units they trample. Trampled enemies take damage based on Centaur Warrunner's strength. Each enemy can be trampled once.
language.lore: The great belt of Omexe, which labels Bradwarden as the greatest warrior of his kind, incites his fellow gladiators to follow him into barbarous combat.
language.aghanimDescription: Heroes affected by Stampede take reduced damage, and are able to run through obstructions, including trees and up cliffs. Enemies affected by Stampede are leashed. Increases duration.

description: Magnus sends out a wave of force, damaging enemy units in a line, pulling them towards him and slowing them for a brief period.
language.lore: Mt. Joerlak was a somewhat unstable mass, and Magnus has learned to channel its reverberations.
language.shardDescription: Increases range, and causes Shockwave to return towards the caster's original cast location after reaching max length, hitting enemies a second time for 0 of the damage.

description: Gives an allied unit bonus damage and cleave on attack. Magnus receives 50% larger bonus.
language.lore: With a deep bellow, Magnus displays his true power.
notes: The bonus damage is based only on base damage and damage from primary attributes.
Cleave damage goes through spell immunity.
Ranged units cannot Cleave.

description: Magnus rushes forward, goring enemy units on his massive tusk. Heroes hit on the way will be dragged to the destination, then damaged and affected by slowed movement and attack speed. The damage is increased based on distance traveled.
language.lore: Magnoceros horns are valuable in direct proportion to their danger to prospective merchants.

description: Magnus changes properties of matter, sucking all nearby enemies in front of him and stunning them with a powerful slam and dealing damage.
language.lore: Magnus fights with the fury of the erupting Mt. Joerlak.

description: Teleports an allied unit back to the base.  Creeps are teleported instantly, while Heroes have a delay before teleporting. If cast on Chen, all units controlled by Chen through Holy Persuasion will be teleported to him after a delay.
Ends all ongoing Nightmares.

Timbersaw whirls extremely sharp edges, damaging enemies and destroying trees around him in an area.  If an enemy hero is affected, it loses some of its primary attribute for a short duration.  Whirling Death will deal bonus damage per tree destroyed.
language.lore: In the case that Rizzrack gets surrounded by the vines and plants of his nightmares, he has an immediate chainsaw defense.
notes: Universal Heroes will lose 5% of each attribute.

description: Timbersaw fires a chain that embeds itself in the first tree it hits, pulling him towards it.  Any enemy in the path takes damage.
language.lore: You never know when you might need to escape from malevolent saplings.

description: Each time Timbersaw is attacked, he gains increased health regen and armor. Hero attacks are counted as 3x the amount.
language.lore: The saw-suit is equipped to react to the slightest touch with fortified defenses.
language.aghanimDescription: Reactive Armor can now be activated to get max stacks and 200 damage barrier. Grants Timbersaw 100 + 75 barrier amount per second for each enemy hero within 600 radius of Timbersaw up to a maximum of 800. After 8 seconds, Timbersaw deals damage to every hero within 600 radius equal to 200 + his remaining barrier amount and loses all of his barrier.

description: Fires Timbersaw's main saw blade at the target location where it will spin in place, dealing damage in an area around it. Enemies caught in the saw blade will move more slowly for every 5% of health missing. The blade deals damage and cuts down trees in its path when fired and retracted. While active the ability costs mana, and Timbersaw loses the ability to attack.
language.lore: The ultimate in anti-flora weaponry.
language.aghanimDescription: Increases Chakram and Second Chakram damage per second.
notes: The Chakram will return if Timbersaw runs out of mana or moves over 2000.0 distance away.

description: Returns the Chakram to Timbersaw.
Covers a target in snot, causing it to have reduced armor and movement speed.  Multiple casts stack and refresh the duration.
language.lore: Having caught a cold while stuck in the snow, Bristleback turns it to his advantage.
language.aghanimDescription: Viscous Nasal Goo becomes a no target area of effect ability, applying to all enemies within range. Increases stack limit.
language.shardDescription: Increases stack limit by %bonus_stack_limit%.

description: Sprays enemy units with quills dealing damage in an area of effect around Bristleback. Deals bonus damage for every time a unit was hit by Quill Spray in the last 14.0 seconds.
language.lore: An enforcer's honor can be a prickly thing.  So can his quills.
notes: Quill Spray damage is not reduced by damage block abilities.

description: Bristleback takes less damage if hit on the sides or rear. If Bristleback takes 300 / 275 / 250 / 225 damage from the rear, he releases a Quill Spray of the current level.
language.lore: Turning his back to a fight might be just the thing.
language.aghanimDescription: Adds active ability to Bristleback. Bristleback rotates towards the targeted direction and, after 0.5s, forcefully ejects 6 sequential Quill Sprays in a tight conical pattern out of his back every 0.35s. Bristleback's facing is locked during this time, he is disarmed, and his speed is reduced by -40.
notes: Bristleback's rear is considered to be within 70 degrees from the back.
Bristleback's side is considered to be within 110 degrees from the back.

description: Bristleback works himself up into a fury every time he casts a spell, increasing his movement speed and damage.
language.lore: 'Temper, temper,' his mum always chided.  But in a fight, a temper can come in handy.
notes: Bristleback's illusions will receive the bonuses.
Items will not trigger Warpath.

description: Tusk compresses shards of ice into a ball of frozen energy that damages all enemies it comes in contact with. When the ball reaches its target destination the shards are released, creating a barrier that lasts for 4 / 5 / 6 / 7 seconds.
language.lore: In the frozen tundra near the Barrier, after the last sun of autumn has set, ice can form with alarming speed.
notes: Creates an impassable barrier.
language.shardDescription: Increases depth of Ice Shards, and enemies trapped within an ice shard are slowed and take damage per second.

description: Tusk begins rolling into a snowball. Allies within a 350 radius can also be added to the snowball by right-clicking on them, even while the snowball is moving. Once launched, any enemies caught in the snowball's path will be stunned and take damage. Each allied Hero in the snowball will add to its damage.
language.lore: Tales are still told of the wild feat that ended the grand brawl at White Fields.
notes: The snowball will break apart a maximum of 3 seconds after launch.
The snowball can be launched early by pressing using the Launch Snowball ability.
Doesn't carry illusions, but will carry Meepo clones and other units that Tusk controls.
Each Meepo clone added to the snowball will add its own bonus damage.
Allies can click on a snowball to add themselves to it.

description: Summons a flying Sigil that slows movement speed by -40% for enemies within 650 radius. Lasts 25 seconds. Cooldown: 30
language.lore: The chill of home!
notes: If no order is given, the Sigil will follow Tusk.

The Sigil has unobstructed movement, has a 310 movement speed, requires 3/3/4/4 hero attacks to destroy and 12/12/16/16 creep attacks to destroy, provides 400/400 vision, and gives a 90/100/110/120 gold bounty.
Heroes deal 1 damage to the sigil, while non-hero units deal 0.25 damage.

description: Tusk connects with his mighty Walrus Punch, a critical strike with bonus damage so powerful it launches its victim into the air. The victim is slowed upon landing.
language.lore: It never matters who throws the first punch, only who throws the last.
notes: Walrus PUNCH has true strike.

description: Skywrath Mage launches a slow-moving bolt of arcane magic, dealing damage to an enemy unit based on Skywrath Mage's intelligence. Upon impact, leaves a debuff that increases Skywrath Mage's spell lifesteal against the target.
language.lore: Within the Ghastly Eyrie's endless intrigue, only the clever and calm can hope to survive.
language.aghanimDescription: When Skywrath Mage casts Arcane Bolt, 1 bolts are created, one aimed at the original target, and the rest - at random enemies within 700 range of the original target. Heroes will take priority.
notes: The projectile moves very slowly (500 ms), providing 325 vision around it.  Upon impact, it will reveal the target area for 3.34 seconds.
Arcane Bolt cannot be disjointed.

description: Skywrath Mage sets off a long range shot that hits the closest hero within a long range. Upon impact, it deals damage and slows in an area of effect. Deals 75% damage to creeps.
language.lore: Those who serve the court of the Ghastly Eyrie are ever locked in covert war. One must always know where danger lurks nearest.
language.aghanimDescription: When Skywrath Mage casts Concussive Shot, a different random target within cast range will be hit with the same ability. Heroes will take priority.
notes: If no enemy heroes are in range or they are in fog, Concussive Shot targets the nearest enemy creep.
Damages creeps around the impact area.
Provides 400 vision around the projectile, and reveals the target area for 3.34 seconds upon impact.

description: Skywrath Mage seals the targeted unit with an ancient rune, silencing it and causing it to take additional damage from spells.
language.lore: A holy incantation, whosoever finds themselves touched by Avilliva's sigil must suffer in penitent silence.
language.aghanimDescription: Anytime Skywrath Mage casts Ancient Seal, a different random target within 700 range will be affected by the same ability. Heroes will take priority.
notes: The magic damage resistance reduction doesn't affect creeps.
language.shardDescription: Ancient Seal debuff now causes other debuffs applied to last 50% longer. Grants vision over the target.

description: Skywrath Mage uses his ultimate magical ability to conjure a precise and violent mystical field that lays waste to his adversaries. Deals massive damage distributed evenly among any Heroes in the area over 2.0 seconds.
language.lore: Only the most practiced of Skywrath sorcerers could hope to shape the skies into such a storm.
