description: Allows using Blink Strike on the Dagger. Grants 800 vision. Lasts up to 2 minutes.

Pangolier curls into an immobile protective ball, gaining debuff immunity, 50%% magic resistance, and allowing him to turn. Can be cast during Rolling Thunder to temporarily hit the brakes. Can cast Rolling Thunder and Shield Crash during Roll Up. If enemies attack Pangolier during this, he will roll away from the attacker, applying Rolling Thunder damage/stun if there are enemies in the way.

Creates an Ice Spire at the target spot, slowing enemies around it. Can take 5 hero hits or 10 creep hits and when destroyed it will create a Frost Blast around it.

Chain Frost can bounce to the Spire if there are no other enemies in range.

Lich can cast Frost Shield on the Spire. Each Frost Shield tick will heal the spire by 1 hero attack.
Ends Pangolier's Roll Up early.
Available for 1.5 seconds after landing Time Walk. If used in this period, you will reverse your time walk back to your previous cast location. Does not affect health or proc scepter hits.
Immediately stops the Freezing Field
Throw your hand (or handy appendage) in the air!
Plant your guild's banner to mark this battleground for you all!
Put on your fancy party hat to celebrate the 10th Anniversary of Dota 2! The hat will stay on your head until you die a horrible death.
Can be cast to land Dawnbreaker into the target area at any time.

Hoodwink charges up and fires a deadly bolt from her crossbow, dealing heavy damage, break and slow to an enemy Hero. The damage and debuff duration scale up to max after 3.0 seconds, and the bolt is fired automatically after 5.0 seconds.
Hoodwink is knocked backwards for a distance of 350 from the force of the shot. Creeps hit by the bolt are damaged for half the values.
language.lore: While her first arbalest was a chance discovery, Hoodwink now takes great care in carving and caring for her own -- of course with some necessary components pilfered or otherwise cleverly procured.
language.aghanimDescription: Decreases wind-up time and increases arrow speed.

description: Hoodwink turns invisible, increasing her movement speed, and creates a decoy illusion that starts aiming a decreased damage Sharpshooter at the nearest enemy hero. If the illusion is attacked or hit by a targeted ability, it is destroyed and it throws a lesser bushwhack towards the enemy.

Tosses a net trap that stuns enemies if they are near a tree in the area.  Affected enemies take damage over time and are pulled towards the tree nearest to them within the target area, and have their vision reduced to 0 for the duration of the stun.
language.lore: Hoodwink favors Ironwood groves for ambushes, but the wary step carefully in all areas of the mistwoods.
notes: Units can be freed from the stun by destroying the tree.
Bushwhack does not hit invisible units.

description: Release the charged up shot, regain ability to move and attack.
language.lore: Fire!

description: Marci grabs an allied or enemy target and throws it effortlessly behind her, damaging and slowing the unit if it's an enemy. Any enemy units in the landing area will also be damaged and slowed.
language.lore: Marci excels at removing obstacles from Princess Mirana's path.

description: Marci taps a hidden power, gaining Fury charges that allow her to deliver a rapid sequence of strikes that slow movement and attack speed of the target for 2.0s. The last strike in every Fury combo creates a damaging pulse around the target. In between Fury combos, Marci is unable to attack for 1.5s.
Marci gains 15% movement speed when Unleash is cast.
language.lore: Though some have sought to understand its origins, Marci rebuffs all attempts to divine the source of her power.
language.aghanimDescription:
Reduces Unleash cooldown by 10.0 seconds and causes Unleash to apply a basic dispel on Marci. While Unleash is Active, all of Marci's abilities unleash pulses when cast. All of Marci's unleash pulses will silence units for 0 seconds.

DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Once a Fury combo is started, each attack must be delivered within 1s or the Fury combo expires.
Removes attack speed limit.

description: Dispels positive buffs from enemies and slows their movement speed.
DISPEL TYPE: Basic Dispel
notes: Can be cast on invulnerable units.
The slow starts at 100%% and decreases over time to 20%%.

description: Marci's loyalty helps ensure survival, imbuing a chosen allied hero and herself with shared lifesteal and attack damage. If Marci and her ally are further apart from each other than 2500, the ally receives no bonuses and Marci only gets 50% until they get close again. Marci's lifesteal also heals her ally and the ally lifesteal also heals Marci.
language.lore: Marci learned at a young age that the best asset in a scrap is a steady companion.
notes: Marci cannot cast Sidekick on herself.
Lifesteal effectiveness gets a 40% penalty against creeps.

description: Marci bounds to the targeted allied unit, choosing a direction and distance she will spring away from it. Upon reaching the unit, Marci lunges to her final destination, damaging and stunning enemies where she lands.
The ally receives 25 / 30 / 35 / 40% bonus movement speed for 5.0s.
language.lore: With a friendly or brazen boost, Marci can find her way into the midst of any fight.
notes: Has 150 minimum jump distance.
Marci's initial run to her target unit can be disjointed.
language.shardDescription: Decreases the cooldown of Rebound, it can be cast on enemies, and causes Marci to also get the speed boost when she casts it.

description: Also grants 50%% magic resistance.
Affects Abaddon and all enemies in a {s:bonus_immolate_aoe} AoE.
Load an ally into this tombstone.

Dark Willow releases her pet wisp to terrorize her enemies. After a short delay, all enemies in the target area become fearful and run toward their home fountain. Terrorize cannot be used while Bedlam is active.
language.lore: You think you know the first thing about fear? Jex'll show you what that word truly means...
notes: Terrorize provides vision on affected units.

description: Fires Hoodwink's attack with an acorn at the target unit.  The acorn bounces to nearby targets, slowing them and dealing a percentage of Hoodwink's attack with bonus damage.
If point targeted, a tree is created at the target position and the acorn will bounce to nearby targets.  The ability may be placed on alt-cast to force this behavior.
language.lore: Though she'll make do with almost anything, Oak and Ironwood acorns make the most effective projectiles -- and the bulk of Hoodwink's stash.
notes: The same target can be hit more than once.
Bounces will seek units in the fog of war in a 525 radius, but not invisible units.
The planted tree lasts for 20 seconds.
Acorn Shot benefits from attack range bonuses.

description: Can equip any item in the neutral item slot

language.displayName: +12% Movement Speed per active Battle Hunger

description: Hoodwink passively has a chance to evade physical attacks while near trees.  When activated, Hoodwink gains bonus movement speed, attack and cast range, phased movement, and tree-walking for a brief time.
language.lore: There's not a nook or cranny in the Wood Tomo'kan out of reach of Hoodwink's paws.

description: Hoodwink becomes invisible near trees after 1.2 seconds of not moving, attacking, or casting spells.

Tosses a boomerang in an arc. Upon contact, it returns to Hoodwink.  The boomerang will deal damage as it passes through or hits enemies, and apply a Hunter's Mark that causes affected enemies to be slowed and be more vulnerable to spell damage.
After a delay, Roshan smashes the ground, causing massive radial damage in an area around him, knocking back all enemies.  The closer to Roshan the enemy is, the more damage it takes.
Roshan tosses a nearby enemy unit at an enemy that is further away.
Roshan becomes immune to physical damage, but takes enhanced magical damage for a brief time.  When Roshan uses Shell, all ability and item cooldowns are refreshed.
Roshan launches devastating beams of incineration from the sky at all enemy heroes outside of 400 range, but within 1200 range.
Roshan breathes a lethal arc of searing fire.
Roshan calls a group of Roshlings to aid him.
Roshan launches a number of slow moving fireballs at all nearby enemies.
